Reviews.Title: “Boutique Means Small”
Reviews.Author: Jclassvan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like to play tourist in our city once in a while, so we decided to check out Le Soleil for a night. I came away with very mixed feelings, so am only rating it average. Perhaps the best way of describing our stay was inconsistent. Reading some of the reviews on here and talking to a couple of others who have stayed here, there seems to be a number of different rates and options available when booking, and from conversations overhead when we were checking in, it doesn't seem that the front desk staff was aware of the options. Some rates apparently include valet parking while others don't. Some come with free internet, and others don't. We had booked a rate that included valet parking, but obviously not free internet. Since we were only there for one night I just hot spotted my phone and used that as it was definitely cheaper than the hotel internet. Hotel is in a good location, and was very clean, but when we both left we agreed that it had not rated very high on our special memories list. Pros: -Good location, close to Canada Place, and safe to walk even at night -Smaller hotel, so you don't have to walk far from elevator to room or through the lobby -Staff were polite and checkin and check out were fairly smooth - Krueg coffee maker and unique snacks Cons or Negative Impressions -Staff, while polite, were not operating at a level that we have found at say the Fairmont Pac Rim. Staff more like what you would find at a Hampton Inn. - Rooms are very small and layout is very different. Boutique/European is marketing term for "expect small". - lack of view, We had a corner room that also had a balcony, but it looked over the rear lane. View was of the restaurant behind the hotel. Bedroom window looked out into a concrete shaft with minimal light. - Room was very humid and this was April and no rain. A/C unit was very noisy when kicking in and trust me it was going on and off all night. - Not a big deal, but compared to other luxury hotels there were a few things missing - bath mat, soap for the bath/shower (only one small bar of soap was provided for both sink and shower), hair dryer - we had a king size bed and there were only two pillows provided, and both have seen better days in terms of thickness (even Hampton Inn or Best Westerns in small towns provide more pillows for a king size bed). - decorating was not our style, overdone with the sun theme, but didn't really detract from our stay Overall, Hotel Le Soleil brands itself as a luxury boutique hotel with outstanding service. I will give them one out of three - boutique. Our visit fell short on the luxury and outstanding service. The lack of view was a big detriment - I felt like we were trapped in between two buildings. If you want to relax in your room and see something other than the concrete walls of the adjacent building I would suggest either Fairmonts or the Pan Pacific at Canada Place.

Reviews.Title: “A charming place - Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Corey Q
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Le Soleil. The hotel is quite cozy and charming. The decor isn't my style, exactly, but the rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. The bathroom has a wonderful large shower, and we had a suite. It wasn't large, but well worth what we paid. There was some noise from housekeeping staff in the hotel and outside street noise, but it was otherwise a comfortable stay. It's close to many downtown amenities, including Pacific Centre and the skytrain. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: senssl
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in great downtown location. Suites are small, but tastefully decorated. Restaurant in hotel had fabulous food at moderate prices. No pool or fitness facility in hotel, but a very nice gym available for a daily rate next door with great facilities and lap pool, sauna, and steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Hotel Le Soleil”
Reviews.Author: Sonya J
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service with a very friendly staff!! Coming from the island, I was able to check in when I got into Vancouver, I had a great clean, quiet suite, that was perfect! I loved the lavish decor, I felt like I was royalty; especially with room serivce in the morning and a nice long soak in my soaker tub! It was nice and central so I could park my car and walk to all my favorite destinations, Tiffany, Robson St, Pacific Centre, and so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them touch your car!”
Reviews.Author: Mikel Anne A
Reviews.Content: We used our Living Social voucher last weekend. On a surface level, the staff is friendly. They upgraded us to a corner suite (which is slightly bigger and quieter). However, the room had one window which opened to an air shaft (e.g. the middle of the building and no light). The other window open to a notch in the building that was roughly 20 feet deep (in other words, no external light from here, either). The Living Social special came with a $25 voucher for "food and beverage." Once we arrived at the hotel we received the voucher, complete with all the fine print. The voucher was for dinner only and was not to be used on alcohol. We didn't see the fine print until we went to use the voucher for breakfast. I had to leave the restaurant to go to the front desk to get the issue cleared up, as it was a bait and switch situation. This took about 15 minutes, as the front desk clerk had to call his sales manager. Finally, I was told I could use the voucher for breakfast. Thank you, but it was a stress that should not have occurred if this information had actually been included in the Living Social offer. Free internet was included with the package. I guess that's good, as I've NEVER stayed at a hotel that actually charged for internet access. Many times the internet speed was so slow that it dropped. At one point I clocked the speed at well under 1 Mbps. That's fine for free, but I would have been quite disappointed if I was forced to pay for service that slow. Finally, we get to the valet parking and this is why I've giving such a low overall rating. As our car was brought out the second morning of our stay as we were preparing to leave, we found a three inch long scratch on the mirror and a chip in the door. Seriously? This car is my husband's pride and joy. He hand washes it every week and knows every inch of that car. When he dropped it off for the valet, he walked around it to check it out and when he picked it up from the valet, he walked around it and checked it out. At some point from the time we dropped it off at the valet and picked it up, it was damaged. After speaking with the front desk clerk and the valet attendant at length and showing them the damage, we were giving the hotel manager's business card. After multiple emails back and forth with the hotel over the past two weeks, we were told they “considered the issue closed.” They told us the area they park the cars in is fully secure and they stated the car must have been “vandalized.” Hmmmm…. If the parking garage is fully secure and the car is vandalized during that time, then the damage was done by an employee. I don’t believe it was vandalized, but I do know that one of the valets was very careless to cause this damage. The $300-500 it will cost us to repair the damage Hotel Le Soleil caused (along with the stress of dealing with their bait and switch tactics) was definitely NOT worth what we saved with our Living Social deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Ren95
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an absolute pleasure to stay in. We arrived at Hotel Le Soleil after travelling straight in from Australia and we could not have picked a better hotel. Every member of staff that we encounted was fantastic, helpfull and very friendly. Check-in and out was friendly and even just passing the reception desk was a joy! The hotel just has a wonderfull decor that is inviting, warm and relaxing. The foyer and main sitting room has lovely big comfotable chairs with a lovely warm fireplace, which was going everytime we passed. The room and decorated in the same style and are boldy charming. The seperate living and bedroom are planned out well and are very accomodating. The room was very clean and tidy, the bathroom has a shower over bath and the counter top is large enough for everything you might bring and more. The bed in our room was just lovely to sleep in, it was very comfortable and the linen and pillows were excellent. We had dinner once and breakfast every morning in the connecting restaurant next door. Our meals for dinner were excellent they did a fantastic job and breakfast each morning (which was included with our room) was small but fresh and nice. The staff in the restaurant were just as accomodating and really lovely. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Vancouver. There are plenty of shopping centers, small shops and places to eat around the hotel. We were traveller with our 2.5 year old son and we did find it a bit hard to find family orrientated places close to the hotel but there were some really nice restaurants that we passed. Also there is a skytrain station not far from the hotel (ask for a map and directions, the staff were really good at this!) which can take you places quickly and very easily. This hotel is for anyone and its a nice change to the big, run of the mill hotels you usually see. Well worth the stay, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Shopping Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: BCSurreyChick
Reviews.Content: A quiet location and easily within walking distance of everything and we walked EVERYWHERE! The staff was all friendly. Parking less expensive than a few other hotels! They also matched internet rate, free wiifi, and included breakfast which consisted of coffee or juice and a muffin or fruit salad. We had an extra room to sleep an extra person. We would definitely stay here again. The Copper Chimney restaurant, located in the hotel, has THE BEST curry, and we highly recommend it! Enjoyed great dinner at the Cactus Club around the corner. Did NOT, repeat, DO NOT eat around the corner, at the restaurant that is not a restaurant, not worth the money so don't even LOOK when you walk by. I think it was called Traders. Horrible food. Dreadful. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Le soleil hôtel vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tulunay
Reviews.Content: It is in downtown an convenient location. Walking distance to water front. Hotel is quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Clair R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and in a great location. The furniture could be called outdated, but I thought it gave the hotel character. It was very French themed, and the restaurant was very good for breakfast. The concierge was very nice and funny and gave great restaurant ideas. I would stay here again, and I highly recommend it! The rooms are a little cramped though, but you will only be staying there to sleep, and it has many other great qualities.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions DO count, Mr. (or Ms.!) Manager!!”
Reviews.Author: NotTooLate
Reviews.Content: If I were the manager of this hotel I would definitely do some staff training on the importance of making an immediate good impression! To clarify, I'm talking about this hotel's only weakness for me - the doorman/valet position. I don't think I have ever met more uncommunicative and unfriendly men in their position! When you arrive at a new "good" hotel you want (expect) to be greeted by some sort of smile and verbal welcome. You expect an explanation of the valet parking service, and on departure you expect fairly speedy return of your car or at least a quick apology and explanation as to why you have to wait. You expect a "thank you and hope you have enjoyed your stay with us" or something similar to encourage the feelings of a developing relationship with the hotel. None of this is unusual service elsewhere but none of this was done at Le Soleil! It was a glaring omission. The front desk and restaurant staff were very pleasant. The room was excellent. The rates were reasonable for its very convenient location.....but, guys, first impressions do count and you need those frontline staff to buck up their style!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaColdToes
Reviews.Content: As a woman traveling alone, I felt very comfortable and safe in this area on the weekend even. I had arrived for business, but found nothing but pleasure on my stay. Easy 5 minute walk to Canada Place. Great restaurants around within very easy walking distance. The bed was amazing, the sheets, the comfort overall made me sleep like a baby. I especially liked the elevator not being accessible unless you use your room key. The concierge was very helpful. The hotel is very clean, as are the rooms. The bar was very well stocked. 2 tv's in the room, one in the bedroom and one in the sitting room. Nice sized bathroom and lots of closet space. The bedroom is a bit cramped for space, but you're only in there to sleep right? I tend to be chilled when in Vancouver in the winter, so when I arrived, I asked for a room with a soaker tub and was accommodated, it was perfect! Parking is by the day across the street in a 4 story parking garage, only 12.00 per day. Starbucks is on the corner, and Cactus Club Restaurant is around the corner. Easy walking distance to Sear/TheBay/London Drugs and Robson Street.

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a second”
Reviews.Author: peewee007
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and well appointed with huge windows overlooking the city, internet was easy, room service was prompt and friendly. Most importantly, I was kind of shocked at how reasonable it was for such a swank setting. We'd read about the "small" rooms but did not have that experience, not at all. Nice large bathroom, friendly staff, I could go on. If you're going to depend on cabs you may have to catch them yourself but now I'm just looking for things to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: damianlandrey
Reviews.Content: Great building and location of the hotel. Stunning views outside and clean surroundings. Staffs are friendly and very accommodating. Rooms are spacey, very clean and worth it for the money. Good taste of food with many choices to choose. Really had a very memorable stay in this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HelenT3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for getting about downtown for shopping, restaurants and even BC Place The front desk was friendly and efficient . when we asked for extras they were at the door within minutes . The only downside was that the rooms were small , We had two teenagers who had to share a sofa bed and the space was quite tight.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS. Girls weekend -”
Reviews.Author: Briana L
Reviews.Content: This was offered on a groupon on their off season so needless to say I paid a fraction of what the room would be worth in peak time. When I called to ask a few questions, which I always do to feel out how the experience in the hotel will be, the gentleman, Paul was incredibly sweet and accommodating. Since it was my first stay, he offered to upgrade to a corner suite on a higher floor (love it when this happens!). We arrived and noticed the hotel was almost tucked in, hidden on Hornby, easy to pass on a one way street! Gorgeous interior, quick and easy check in and the hallways were glamorous and decadent. There was a definite boutique/french quality to this hotel. Our one bedroom suite was stunning, not the largest floor space but manageable with 4 women getting ready for a night on the town. Anything we needed, was up to our door in under 3 minutes. Very helpful staff and incredible experience. We were slow to leave the following day, and they front desk assured there was no hurry at all.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Stay at LeSoleil Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Scott C
Reviews.Content: Our LeSoleil Experience: We had the pleasure of staying at Le Soleil Hotel in Vancouver from December 30th, 2011 to January 3rd, 2012. Right from the moment we arrived we knew we were going to enjoy our stay. The bellmen were courteous. The lobby was warm and elegant. Our check-in experience was seamless, the front desk staff made us feel like we were right at home. Overall the staff was very attentive. They made some excellent recommendations for restaurants, shopping areas and directions. We were lucky enough to stay in the penthouse suite which as just beautiful. The suite was huge and very comfortable. It had a master bedroom, with very comfortable bedding, a bathroom with double sinks, a shower & Jacuzzi tub. It had a kitchen and dining room which was nice because we ordered takeout from a terrific Thai Restaurant in the area on New Years Eve before heading out on the town. The suite also included an office and a main room with 20 foot ceilings. The huge rooftop patio surrounding the suite was also a nice surprise, a bit cold in December/January; but it provided some beautiful views of the water, mountains and cityscape. The hotel is in a perfect location, within a five minute walking distance from the waterfront and great shopping on Robson St. To top off our stay we ran into a Vancouver Canuck, Ryan Kessler in the lobby at check out. We would hesitate staying at Le Soleil again and we would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in downtown Vancouver. Scott & Melissa,

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chic, great beds, but overall a bit bland”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl_68
Reviews.Content: I typically only stay at boutique hotels - largely for the unique experience, the customized attention and that little something extra. While the location and nicely branded (sun) rooms are convenient, the overall experience was a bit bland. The staff are polite but not overly friendly or helpful. I would have really appreciated some advice on places to go for dinner (not the restaurant next door!) and ways to make my business trip to Vancouver even more memorable. After all, this is the city that hosted the Olympics - certainly there is more to see than Holt Renfrew! I will say, however, that the beds are unbelievable - I wish mine at home was as comfortable! Well done there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: zvezda9
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through a Living Social special, and it is a place we would gladly return to. From check in to check out, we had a smooth experience, and the hotel was beautiful and comfortable. We were given a corner room that gave us a great urban view of downtown Vancouver out of floor to ceiling windows. It was great to sit with a cup of coffee and watch the city go by. Others have commented on the small size of the room, but we felt that our suite had ample space. The bedroom itself was tight, mostly large enough for the bed and a dresser with a television on top, but since there was an entire other room (that even had a door for bedroom privacy), there was plenty of room to be comfortable. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. There was a small problem involving noisy guests on our floor, but we called the front desk to notify them and a manager promptly came to the floor to address the issue. I was very satisfied by the hotel's handling of the situation. This is an exceptional property that I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful - but small - room”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTinamucks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very posh, boutiquey, city, elegant type hotel but the staff at the hotel was super friendly and welcoming. We had a suite reserved and they put us in a corner suite, very nice, and gave us free wifi - they were just super friendly and generous! Everything was beautiful in the room. The only reason I gave four stars not five was because the room was so tiny. There were four of us in a corner suite and it was crowded. Had a nice view of the busy city outside and were right in the thick of things. Once the bed in the living room was opened up, we really had to stash things away to have room just to walk from one room to another and to get to the desk etc. So it was an elegant, cozy hideout in the middle of the city. Made for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Return customer to this excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tykwong
Reviews.Content: This is about the 3rd time we've spent Christmas in Vancouver and stayed in Hotel Le Soleil for our stay. It has lots of the plush amenities of a luxury hotel yet small and tucked away to one side of downtown so as to be a quiet getaway from downtown away from the crazies and the traffic. We like to call it our little boutique hotel getaway. My wife has back issues so we are picky about our hotel and the beds. My wife needs the bed to be on the firmer side yet I love the soft pillow top. Love their soft linen. And the separate temperature control for the bedroom and the living room area. The rooms comes with everything you'd need, and more (for a price of course for the "more"). The "more" includes everything from snacks to wine to thoughtful little items like sewing kit in case you lose a button. Love the Aveda products for the bath. And the sliding doors so as to not have to waste room for the swing of a normal door (for both the bath and bedroom) We have a child so we love being able to put our baby to sleep in the bedroom while we watch TV on the sofa. Even the heating and cooling is super quiet (we have had issues in other hotels with noisy units which gave us restless nights) Everything is always so cozy and comfortable from the bath towels to the sofa for TV viewing. Decor is fabulous and everything feels luxurious. It's a smallish boutique hotel so not too many rooms per floor. Which also means a very quiet hotel and guaranteed restful night sleep. Of all the times we've stayed here, we have never heard our neighbors. Not from above nor from the sides. And the elevators are always readily available. Service is top notch and I tip them accordingly. Super friendly and informative even though I know my way around Vancouver by now. Never had an issue with the valet or my car. Because it's smallish, I get super fast response. And I often call down for my car before heading down, so the valet would already have my car pulled around by the time I arrive. I also love the location too since it's "downtown" but it's really on the northern edge, off to one side. Which means Robson is only a walk away, and we've walked to the Vancouver Christmas Market 2 years in a row now. Perfect for getting your buzz on for a good time yet won't need to drive back to the hotel. A Skytrain station is a block away so you could get to most parts of Greater Vancouver and beyond without even getting your car. There is a Starbucks across the street for our morning Mocha and a couple of drugstores 2-3 blocks away for any misc items you need. Plenty of restaurants around too. But I love that it's a block away from Pender St. I can drive in and out of downtown without having to deal with downtown traffic. And Pender is a direct drive to Stanley Park or Chinatown going the other way. And actually through Chinatown is the route we often took to get out of downtown in a jiffy since we have to have our dim sum for our daily brunch since Vancouver is famous for chinese food right? The only thing negative is that it is a luxury hotel so it is pricey compared to other non-luxury hotel. But you get what you pay for. Le Soleil is cheaper than other luxury downtown hotels and well worth it too. That and I always wait for deal online then go with one of the hotel packages since I'm on their mailing list. Otherwise, I have nothing but positive things to say about Hotel Le Soleil and will probably see you again next Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron7953
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at this hotel in July. It was in a great location for walking around the lower half of downtown Vancouver. The room was typically European - small but adequate and nicely laid out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a small restaurant and bar attached to the hotel and we tried it one evening. The food was very good with reasonable, for the area, prices. Again, the big draw was the location. My only minor complaint was the poor quality of the wifi service. Not exactly a must for all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!”
Reviews.Author: Janet H
Reviews.Content: I had no idea what to expect in this hotel before we arrived...Wow! What a great experience..From the doorman waiting for us, helping with our luggage to the front desk people who could advise us on where to go for great food and shopping..Whenever i asked for something they bent over backwards to satisfy all our needs...It's so incredibly quiet, even for being downtown....This is the palce to stay while in Vancouver.....

Reviews.Title: “Heater is a tad noisy”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: This is a top choice high-end hotel in downtown Vancouver. Most rooms are suites, though there are a few traditional style hotel rooms. We loved everything about it except for the noisy HVAC unit. After we went to bed, every so often when the heater kicked-in, the noise from the HVAC activating woke us. Oh well; we’ll stay here again in a heartbeat. For a long (hour or so) culturally colourful walk head up Hornby to Robson, turn right and cruise by the eclectic mix of high rent stores, stroll on down to Denman. Hang a left up Denman past the richly flowered corner stores and ice cream shops. When you reach Davie St, turn left and walk past the numerous apartments, shops, coffee houses, resturants and bars to Hornby. You’ll be back at L’Soliel in short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brendadoug
Reviews.Content: We went with our friends for a night in Vancouver and a day shopping. Centrally located for shopping restaurants and night life. Were pleasantly pleased, enjoying the Valet Parking. Excellent staff very friendly. Rooms were spacious with sitting area off the bedroom, two TV's one in the sitting room, one in the bedroom. Bedroom had a pocket door for privacy. Comfortable bed with wonderful bedding. Had breakfast in the Copper Chimney Restaurant accessable throught the lobby. Enjoyed sitting in front of the lobby fireplace after walking around town. Strongly recommend Le Soleil

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 2 weeks..”
Reviews.Author: Dilsangel
Reviews.Content: I was on work for 2 weeks,and a friend had recommended this beautiful boutique hotel...its right in the heart of downtown,walking distance to everything.. The staff was friendly and even changed my room for me when i,d requested a smoking room. It had a huge terrace and that suited me fine.. Home away from home! I,d recommend it to all..

Reviews.Title: “It is my first review....”
Reviews.Author: Martin D
Reviews.Content: It happens 2 years ago.... I was travelling with my son.... Hard to find parking in downtown... But it was so nice... very good front desk... They parked my car Traveller just go there to smell the common area...¸ It smell like coconut.... Downtown Vancouver.... You will love it

Reviews.Title: “One thing bad, everything else good”
Reviews.Author: don666
Reviews.Content: There's a lot of good things at Hotel Le Soleil: the location, ability to get a deal off Living social or Groupon with free parking (otherwise $26 a day), great service, decent room-suites with windows that open, large showed (but no tub), free newspapers (National Post and Wall Street Journal), a real desk, quiet corridors, cleanliness, etc. etc. It was especially nice that when I got up earlier than my partner, I was able to go into the living room and close the door to the bedroom. But if you enjoy a good night's sleep then, you might want to reconsider. At one point in the past, the king-sized bed was new and no doubt top-line. By the time we slept on it, its springs had given out, and it sagged so badly toward the middle that it you couldn't lie on your back without rolling downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Our "regular place" when staying the night in town”
Reviews.Author: ElleVancouver11
Reviews.Content: I really like this place, it is not too big, get checked in promptly, the rooms are lovely. Separate sitting room, which is great if one of you has insomnia! The beds are very comfy and clean with crisp sheets ahhh. Overall it's a lovely little boutique hotel in the heart of the city AND resonably priced...including having a great "locals" rate for us folks luckily enough to call Vancouver home.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, boutique-y”
Reviews.Author: snoju
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business in Vancouver. The location is very good for downtown, and within walking distance of the float plane terminal, close to Skytrain. It is a small, attractive hotel. A little tight on space, but the rooms, if my small suite is anything to go by, make good use of the space. I am not sure if my small suite would have been better as a single room; I leave that up to the designers. The hotel has an arrangement with the YWCA next door for fitness, at a small fee. No complaints; I would go there again, especially given the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “French-style boutique hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: granitedesk020
Reviews.Content: Very clean, relatively quiet, French-style boutique hotel in downtown Vancouver was a pretty good value. Near the corner of Hornby and Dunsmuir, very close to shopping, classic large hotels (check out the lobbies and enjoy a drink in their lounges), and the waterfront at Canada Place, etc. Separate sitting room. Pocket doors on bathroom and bedroom a little annoying, but designed for optimal use of space. Unexpected outliers to a nice experience were no washcloths nor bath matt in the bathroom, and very impersonal staff--how can you walk within one foot of the doorman and get no recognition at all, several times? The Copper Chimney restaurant that joins the lobby has really interesting decor and adequate breakfast, but very, very expensive. Get your breakfast included or dine elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tibagrl
Reviews.Content: I saw the groupon deal and called the hotel before purchasing to see if they had any availability for the night we were interested in before buying the groupon. The reservation agent at the hotel told me that they did indeed have availability for our requested night AND he told me that he would beat the groupon price if I booked over the phone with him! I am a fan of boutique hotels and this is one of my favorites to date. The room was a corner suite with a sitting area and then a hallway to the bathroom and mini-bar/coffee/closet area which ended up in the bedroom. The king size bed was SO comfortable with excellent quality linens and the best pillows. It was nice to be able to open the bedroom window and get some fresh air too! I definitely appreciated the iPod docking clock radio, it's always nice to be able to listen to your own music when away from home. The soaker tub was great, it's so nice to have your entire torso covered with water! The Aveda soaps, body wash and shampoo were also appreciated. The showerhead was a little lame though, it had virtually no pressure. I understand that it's probably low-flow, however I have low-flow at home and the pressure is much stronger. Loved the robes and the towels were nice and big. Although they felt kind of rough, they were actually quite soft. We had room service in the morning, ordered the night before from the menu left on the pillow. We couldn't decide if we were in the mood for French toast or eggs benedict so we ordered one of each and split them. The food was served promptly, hot and it was DELICIOUS. The french toast was actual baguette bread, cinnamony and just so yummy and the eggs were cooked perfectly for the bennies and the hollandaise sauce was the best, with just a bit of a cayenne bite! The room also included free wi-fi and valet parking. We didn't use the internet but the parking was much appreciated. The ice machine is on the 3rd floor, not a big deal but I heard a little grumbling from another guest. All in all an excellent stay and I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others, both out of towners or locals!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: madforkay
Reviews.Content: great location, very nice room and helpful staff. would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: SiskaC
Reviews.Content: When Groupon featured Hotel Le Soleil, I jumped at the chance to make a reservation based on its existing reputation. From the reception to valet bringing up our car, it was a pleasant, well cared for hotel to visit. Upgraded to a corner suite, we enjoyed our corner suite, the uber comfortable bed, and the little sitting room. I cannot fault them for anything; it was an excellent hotel, especially considering the INSANE deal that we got through the Groupon. Little touches like Aveda bathroom products, an ipod docking station, ample closet space and a beautiful foyer all added to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very special escape in big city”
Reviews.Author: LJHob
Reviews.Content: This all suites hotel was the perfect location for us. We were in town for a conference and this was just a block and a half away from the meetings. It was surrounded by great restaurant choices and close to more choices on Robson Street. The staff was wonderful and our room had a lovely deck outside the sliding glass doors for relaxation after busy day at meetings. Close quarters for a family of 4 but doable if on a budget. All in all a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Downtown Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Rainy_Vanc0uver
Reviews.Content: I decided to have a date night with my wife (left the kids at granma's) and booked this hotel downtown... We got a great rate and we were not quite sure what to expect. Were we ever surprised at the quality of the hotel and service we received. The hotel has a very regal french feel to it...very luxurious and our room was huge! We didn't realize we were getting a multi room suite complete with a separate living room. The staff were always very pleasant and constantly referring to us by name! We thought that was a good touch...Needless to say, our date night turned out fantastic and we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “love LeSoleil!”
Reviews.Author: Pat1958277
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Beautiful suite and seriously comfortable King bed. The staff were excellent - very laid back but extremely professional. Location is perfect - walking distance to just about everywhere! I appreciated the fact that there was a list of pricing for items in the mini bar including a selection of other items like chocolate, bottle of wine, nuts, even an "intimacy kit". We've been to hotels where you utilize the mini bar and wait for the outrageous charges. At least this way you could know what you were paying before making the purchase. Loved the fact that although we only stayed one night we could utilize the parking for the entire next day without any extra charges. We will definately go back !

Reviews.Title: “What? PAY for internet?”
Reviews.Author: nickilolk
Reviews.Content: 9 dollars a day for internet? You have got to be kidding! And they didn't even mention that, when I asked for it on the first day. Other than that, the hotel is fine. Huge rooms, contemporary bath room, classic interior and TWO flat television in the room. But the staff never greeted good morning or even nodded at me as I passed the front desk in the morning. Disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “great little getaway”
Reviews.Author: TheSchindells
Reviews.Content: What a treasure this little place is. We found this and got a great deal through Groupon. Reduced rate notwithstanding, the staff treated us like VIPs. The hotel is lovely. I was amazed at how big it is (we were on the 15th floor) because it somehow manages to pull off that clubby 'boutique' feeling. Our mini-suite had a lovely little sitting room, large bathroom, roomy bedroom with huge king size bed, lovely extras. Keurig coffee maker with single cup coffees. No fridge, unfortunately, and getting ice was twelve floors away, (or room service). We were surprised that wifi was an added cost and decided we could live without it while there. Our view left something to be desired, but I hope they gave the view rooms to out-of-towners. (We are locals, but there for a getaway, Lions game, etc.). I was really impressed with the night staff's attention to security and safety details. Adam, the parking guy (among other duties I imagine), was intelligent and efficient, the kind of person who makes you remember a hotel and want to return. The housekeeping was superb. The bed and linens were wonderful. Two large flat screen televisions. Valet parking. We really liked this little place. We would gladly recommend it to anyone and would love to return. thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location, Boutique Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Walrus2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Le Soleil several times over the past few years. Spacious rooms, actually suites, that are always very clean and comfortable. Downtown Vancouver is at your doorstep, with great access to the skytrain routes as well, including the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, stylish 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keefletrucker
Reviews.Content: We travelled with two kids and immediately got a free upgrade to a suite, despite buying through a third party. Rooms weren't huge, but the suite gave us some well needed space. Beds were great and good shower. 32' flat screens in both rooms with cable. Coffee maker and kettle. Supply limited to two servings of each however. They charge for the rest, which is a bit tight given the rack rate. Staff were good in the hotel itself. We ventured to the attached restaurant for brekkie one day and the staff were pretty poor. Superb location and within walking distance of Granville island, Stanley park and most of the Downtown shopping areas. Good access to transport links too. All in all, top hotel. Ask for a corner room and book though one of the last minute style sites to get best deal. Vancouver is awesome if this is your first trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricardo_emp
Reviews.Content: We had one night between flights and trips in the region and stayed here in the Le Soleil Hotel. The entrance is truly imposing and regal and the staff were on hand to ensure a good check in. The valet took our rental car and ensured we weren't given a ticket...good details. Our room was on the 8th floor with views of downtown and was quiet and comfortable. I liked the division between the bedroom and sitting room which gave a small room the feeling of much more space.

Reviews.Title: “I'm paying for internet w/advertising?”
Reviews.Author: 1975_Valiant
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveller so I spend a lot of time online when I'm in my hotel room. Many places offer free internet access with your stay so I'm unused to paying a daily fee. So it really cheeses my biscuits when I pay a fee AND then receive popup advertising in my browser. Every time I access a web page, a portion of my page is filled with an advertisement by R66T who was chosen by Le Soleil to supply their internet service. Either give me free access with ads or charge me $8 and stay off my browser. But you came here for a review of the hotel, right? Here we go: As a boutique hotel, Le Soleil is lovely. Glamourous fabrics on the furniture and draped across the windows. The marble bathroom, gold striped wall paper and the carved sun on my door - all of it is so pretty. Even the bathroom towels have their logo stamped into them. My room is quiet despite having neighbours on both sides, which means I must have nice thick walls. I get a good sleep. The windows are not quite as thick. I face north and two or three times each evening (and once in the morning) I get to hear some sort of street noise that reminds me of bags of glass bottles being poured into a metal dumpster. Clean, clean, clean. No dirty carpet, no dust on a forgotten ledge, no smudges on the walls. I never see the cleaning staff yet my room is spotless when I return at 5 pm. My room is 8 steps from the elevator yet I hear no comings & goings. I have a bathrobe, decent closet space with two fabric-covered hangers, an in-room safe, a coffee machine by Keurig, toiletries by Aveda and a mini bar filled to the brim with beverages. I can dip into the convenience tray in my room and be billed for a jar of cashews, a canister of oxygen (I kid you not) or a box of prophylactics at my whim. When I book a wake up call the person at the front desk is friendly and prompt. I get a smile from them when I walk past the front desk and out the door. I'm four blocks from the harbour, three blocks from the Skytrain, two blocks from a pharmacy/postal outlet and there's a fitness building (akin to a YMCA) right next door. So although the incursion of advertising on my browser infuriates me there's no way I can give this hotel a bad review. The staff are too nice, the room is too comfortable and the building is too well-located to do so. Thumbs-up for this hotel and a "Very Good" rating that would have been "Excellent" if their double-dipping tactics with internet access hadn't left me with a sour taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely respite”
Reviews.Author: TravelLee3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight and were happy to be greeted so warmly and helped so quickly. Then we saw our beautiful room and were even happier and ready to go to sleep to prepare for our exciting cruise the following day. I will admit that like others have mentioned, the sofa bed was a bit hard but I still slept like a baby and my parents really liked the bed in the bedroom. It was also nice that the bathroom was not in the bedroom which made it better for all of us. This isn't the same at other suite hotels. The location was great for walking for food as well as to the harbour and we loved all the pretty sun decorations everywhere. It was a great way to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: westford
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this wonderful boutique hotel in BC. Just a few blocks north of the pier and downtown. We considered the Fairmont but would have had a typical room, not here, the room was "special". the bed was great, the service fantastic....the staff accommodating and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Vancouver. Breakfast was not included which worked for us because we don't eat breakfast, coffee in the room was perfect. A great say in a great hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: flightriskToronto
Reviews.Content: Spent the week at the hotel during out stay in Vancouver. Central location (if you like walking) in the downtown core and right on the subway line, which makes for a quick escape from the airport. Great service from the hotel and excellent staff that help you on your way to the sights and some things that are off the beaten track. The hotel room itself was pretty awsome. Very clean and had its own living room, which I believe comes standard. Although why you would need 2 flat screens in 200 sq ft of space is beyond me. but if you are coming with children its a great treat. we didn't eat at the hotel next door as we liked to find off the beaten track cafes and markets, but it looked good and smelled excellent in the evenings. I would definitely recommend this hotel for future travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Mswow
Reviews.Content: The suite was decorated nicely. The staff was helpful. Only 4 blocks? to the cruise docks. there is a mall and many restaurants nearby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not the best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gorah123
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Canada my wife and I stayed in 2 Vancouver hotels. Le Soleil was good but the Wedgewood was excellent. Our room in Le Soleil could have been a bit larger but everything we needed was there and clean. Service in the hotel was very good and helpful. The restaurant attached was disappointing really-trying to offer a fusion menu, but the place lacked atmosphere in our view

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about Hotel Soleil”
Reviews.Author: ArlynA
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about Hotel Soleil. Visually this place is stunning. The pictures don't do this place justice. I stayed here with my husband for my birthday weekend. The room we had was great, we stayed I believe it was the 10th floor, and a great view of the streets below. We were walking distance from several great restaurants, shops, and nightlife. We were driving distance from major tourist destinations like Granville Island, Stanley Park, and China town. It was a mix of reviews on the service. Initially, I felt like the front desk people were amazing, they gave us maps, drew out our route for our dinner plans, and even offered to call a cab service. Another young valet helped us find shops around the area, and suggested a great itinerary. However, throughout our stay I felt somewhat confused by some of the staff since the information they were giving us didn’t correlate from what was on the hotel site and our own research. Sometimes I felt like different people had different rules. For example, we wanted to go to the gym (which is actually the YWCA) next to the hotel. The pictures from the hotel site make it seem like it’s on-site. We were given 2 "complimentary" passes) Saturday night. When we checked out we found out they charged $25 per pass! I was so upset because we were told they were free. Just a warning-Please just verify prices before you accept anything from this hotel. Also parking is quit a pain. You can pay $25 a day for valet (we did this the first night), or park across the street for around $10 (the second night). We did both. Also waiting around for the valet takes so much time, and during the wait time we heard several staff loudly complaining about how they wish they weren't there, and wanted the shift to end. We all complain, but it shouldn't be infront of customers. The location was great, the rooms were pristine, but the service was mixed. I don't think we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RickSpurInTN
Reviews.Content: While some people think the location of this hotel is not great, it was in perfect walking distance of many fine restaurants and the marina. The lobby is beautiful and the staff is very accommodating. I definitely would stay again if ever in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jeffCT
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Le Soleil and were very pleased with everything. The first room we were placed in had a toilet issue which was handled perfectly. They couldn't have been nicer, and more efficient in taking care of us. As soon as I notified the front desk of the issue there was a maintenance man at our door in less than 2 minutes. When it was determined that the issue would need some work, we were offered a corner king suite, and they moved us in within 10 minutes. We were extremely impressed by the level of service at this hotel. All of the staff is attentive, efficient, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Responsive staff, loved having a little separate lounge area”
Reviews.Author: smulholland24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a business trip. We chose the hotel due to it's location to our client. Our room consisted of a small entrance lounge area with space for suitcase, sofa, occasional chair and flat screen TV. You then had the bathroom, amenities and wardrobe before entering the bedroom (door to close off). This is perfect if one person wants to watch TV whilst the other sleeps or works. The bedroom was small, but given the other seating space more than adequate. There was a desk, cabinet with TV and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was well provisioned and the shower was nice and powerful. I did have an issue with the room but found the hotel staff very approachable and had a response within a very short time, with the issue resolved to my satisfaction. We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant and I enjoyed both. The business center is actually a tiny room on the 3rd floor which has two computers with internet and printers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaylien
Reviews.Content: Visit Vancouver quarterly and have stayed at the Le Soleil on many occasions. The front desk staff is always freindly and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable and roomy. Depending on what season you are visiting, the cost of a room could be pricey. The location is great, close to the waterfront, and the convention center, short walk to shopping and the skytrain station. Truly enjoy staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We just love this place!”
Reviews.Author: ErnestTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is our first choice for any stay in Vancouver and what a great little boutique hotel! Decor is very European and the customer service is excellent. The rooms are clean and well appointed but are also generally quite luxurious in feel. Most rooms offer a separate living room area or suite which works out amazingly well for hosting visiting family members not to mention that Le Soleil is also pet friendly. Located right next to a really nice YWCA with pool if you are a fitness enthusiast. They also have a pretty good restaurant if you are looking for a tasty breakfast, lunch or dinner although a little on the pricey side. This is a great place to stay if you like boutique hotels and also very quiet but the online deals make this place an especially good value for any stay in the downtown Vancouver area!

Reviews.Title: “Nicey - but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: asleeponthebeach
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Soleil is a boutique style property. Lovely lobby. Quick check-in. While room was not yet ready (we arrived early from cruise ship) hotel accommodated our bags while we took off for a little sightseeing. Upon our return, our room was clean, crisp and quite nice. Smallish sitting room, large bath, beverage area/minibar in hallway and bedroom beyond. Corner room - not much of a view, but the sunlight was delightful. After we settled in, we again headed out, and returned exhausted. Hotel recommended Indian restaurant next door - which also serves as their "in-house" restaurant for breakfast. Good selection of not just Indian entrees. Quite good. I'd give the whole experience a go again, but wish it wasn't quite so spendy.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice over Priceline crapshoot”
Reviews.Author: MontanaCBears
Reviews.Content: We were a married couple traveling with a single adult and wanted a 4* hotel near Canada Place the night before a cruise. We thought we could get a good room from priceline or hotwire, but decided the risk of getting an unsuitable room wasn't worth it. We wanted a queen bed for us and a separate bedroom for the single. With priceline we would have had to get 2 rooms @ $125 plus a room because they only guarantee sleeping arrangements for 2 per room, or hotwire we could have specified sleeping arrangements for 3 for around $125, but could have ended up with 2 double beds side by side. Some of the hotel options the bidding sites offered could have landed us in a hotel that we really didn't want. We opted for Hotel Le Soleil that had a queen bed in a bedroom and a sofabed in the living area for about $210, and the reviews were great. We we'rent disappointed! The room was a tad on the small side but we valued the price, privacy, cleanliness and friendliness. The sofabed was ok for a 20 something guy, but someone with a bad back wouldn't have been happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, everything you need and great value”
Reviews.Author: HKtraveller00
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this place by a friend and what a great place. Nice staff, good location for downtown, shops, harbour, park etc.. Room was great, decor fab, and staff were helpful. Breakfast was lovely too, Quite a contrast to some of the bigger chains! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckydog50
Reviews.Content: Had not previously heard of Hotel Le Soleil. Found it through a Google search and looked at reveiws on Tripadvisor. Got a very good internet rate. Great location. Exceptional service and plenty of room. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RadHal
Reviews.Content: Le Soleil is a lovely in a great location, within walking distance or a short cab to most tourist areas. The room was attractive and clean, the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: zoecatCA
Reviews.Content: Great individualized service. Location was central and hotel very well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, we'd definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Paladin_Tx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very conveniently located in downtown Vancouver. The hotel opened in 2000, so it's relatively new and they keep it very well maintained. The facilities were very clean. They provide a complimentary turn-down service upon request, although it was a little earlier than we'd prefer - between 5:00 - 6:00 pm. The staff was extremely competent and helpful. The hotel restaurant (The Copper Chimney) had great service and abundant food - although like everything else in Vancouver, expensive. The concierge will guide you to places near the hotel where you can eat for a fraction of the cost. One place is just across the street. The rooms are smaller than you typically see in the U.S., but nicely laid out. We were glad we paid a little extra to get a corner suite. Most of the things you want to do in downtown Vancouver are within walking distance of the hotel. We had a great time and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ellen20
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for myself and two coworkers who were attending a business conference at the Vancouver Convention Centre. Hotel Le Soleil was not listed in the materials provided by the VCC, but I chose to book it anyway based on its competitive price and location convenient to the VCC (just a few blocks walk) and other downtown attractions, and of course the good reviews on TripAdvisor. It turned out to be a great choice for us. The hotel itself is lovely and the (all suite) rooms are spacious and appear recently updated. I slept especially well during my stay - the bed was extra comfortable, pillows abundant and blackout curtains were a blessing. The only small drawbacks are that neither breakfast nor WiFi are included in the room cost. They do offer somewhat affordable room service and there are many places nearby where one can grab a quick bite, and WiFi cost an extra $24 for three days. These little "complaints" are not enough to deter me from giving Hotel Le Soleil a very high recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Like_2_TravelCalgary
Reviews.Content: We only stay in this hotel during our many visits to Vancouver as it offers the best value in the city - quiet rooms, helpful staff, great location. We generally dont eat lunch or dinner in the restaurant, not because there's anything wrong, its due to the fact Vancouver has so many great restaurants to try! However, one thing really annoys me – the hotel has a notice in the bathrooms regarding the re-use of towels to minimize the impact on the environment. But at the same time, they are providing bottled water that was shipped from Fiji…….not much consideration to the environment in this case! The obvious hypocrisy makes me wonder whether their organization is really interested in reducing their impact on the environment or just reducing operating costs. Is this another case of Corporate “Green-washing”?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASASG_7
Reviews.Content: This is a "boutique" hotel, not part of a chain. The location is excellent, close to Coal Harbour & Canada Place on a "good" block, walking distance to museums, etc. The lobby is pleasant, nicely cozy with a fireplace and a vanilla scent. The staff was very welcoming and our rate (discounted off the standard rate) made it a good value. That all being said, our room was not well laid out for two people. While the king bed was nicely roomy and comfortable, and the bathroom was pleasant (not as great as more upscale hotels, but prettily done), but if one person was standing at the wardrobe, the second person was effectively trapped in the bathroom. Another small peeve, replacement coffee pods were not left for our second morning (on request they were provided). Since we got a very good rate we didn't mind much, but if I'd paid rack rate I would have asked for a bigger room. Also, the fact that they charge for Wi-Fi was a surprise -- the chains tend to provide it at no cost for loyalty customers. Restaurant looked very inviting but our plans didn't give us a chance to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: barmerinc
Reviews.Content: The Wifi slow but it was Perfect! The Staff great and location to the port walking distance. Got off the ship and went right over.. no lines!! GREAT! and my room was ready early. Breakfast great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious & Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Nylo1970
Reviews.Content: You feel like royalty at this hotel. Everything you see and touch is rich. This hotel does a very... very nice job! This is my second time staying here for business. I love that you get access to a full service health club righ next door.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weegeewoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 2011. Traveling were the four of us (2 adults, 2 young children) and my parents. I like the way the rooms were set up. My parents' room had a similar layout: living area with couch, TV and sliding glass doors to outdoor space then a hallway off which there was the bathroom on one side and coffee maker and closet on the other side and down the end of the hall was the bedroom. I loved the fact that the bedroom was separated (with door) as it allowed for more privacy and better sleep. The beds were very comfortable and everything about this hotel had a feeling of newness and cuteness. This hotel reminded me of the Klimpton hotels - a charm that is unique to the hotel with little details that add both whimsy and comfort. The staff was also very nice. We parked in the lot next to the hotel, not across the street. We had breakfast at a bagel shop around the corner. For dinner we went to the RainTree Grill which was an outstanding experience. Next day for lunch we went to Joe Fortes which was another amazing dining experience. Then for dinner we went to a restaurant just a couple of streets or so down ... I don't recall the name ... I should have written this review as soon as we got back. Anyway, the hotel is in a great location as we were also able to walk to the shopping center and, actually, we walked everywhere except for the RainTree Grill and Stanley Park, but my mom also can't walk that far. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Vancouver in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for the price and quality”
Reviews.Author: MWisnovsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two young children. We booked a deluxe queen but when the desk clerk saw the children he upgraded us to a corner suite. Great room with separate bedroom. Quite place with excellent staff and service, fast valet, very comfortable beds. Only things to change would be wireless speed (noted in many reviews already), coffee/tea service downstairs. If the price is "right" I will not be looking for another hotel next time I am going to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Double charged VISA with no resolve.”
Reviews.Author: Jenmbc
Reviews.Content: Our second time staying at the hotel. We stayed for valentines and upon returning home to ontario saw that our Visa had a random $213.00 amount charged to it. We called and nobody could tell us what the amount was for, and guessed that another guests charge was put on our card, excuse me?!?!? it's been SIX WEEKS since our stay, and i've called multiple times speaking with the accounting department and the hotel manager STILL no resolve and no money credited back to our Visa. This stay was supposed to be a romantic gift and this entire mess has completely spoiled the occasion and is still an ongoing stress. the room service food was ok, cold when it arrived to our room which kind of spoiled it.

Reviews.Title: “good location in wanting to be downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Canada55plus
Reviews.Content: a good location - rooms somewhat small - more "European boutigue" feel to size and laid back staff . Staff helpful when aproached but otherwise keep to themselves. Very clean, well appointed rooms. Good value for the dollar for a downtown Vancouver location

Reviews.Title: “a very nice place”
Reviews.Author: m9115
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the nicest places we have ever stayed at. A great location down town. The room was beautiful, bed was wonderful. The staff was top notch, friendly and helpful.Could not have asked for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with superb service”
Reviews.Author: gnat23
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel conveniently located a short walk form the convention center and downtown, and a nice walk to Stanley Park. Train form the airport stops close by as well. Rooms are nicely appointed, though bathroom fan was extremely loud. Service was very friendly and helpful, and when I complained that wireless was terribly slow they unhesitatingly refunded me the fee. Overall an excellent stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1005jerome
Reviews.Content: I stayed in LeSoleil for four nights in January. The room was spacious and immaculate. The restaurant attached to the hotel had an excellent, a bit pricey, breakfast. The dinner menu was inventive and very good. The staff, especially the folks at the front desk, are very helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay. The individual rooms in the corner suite are small, but with two of them, it's not so bad (we were three adults). Comfortable furnishings. Unlike one previous poster, we found the service to be very friendly and attentive. Called for towels -- came within 5 minutes. Couldn't get our card to work in the elevator - two people there to help us immediately. Etc. We didn't park a car, so no comment on the price of parking. I'm still absolutely unclear on the internet -- first, I agree, it was very spotty. second, you had to call down to get a code, which was annoying. third, it was supposed to be $8.99 a day, but I never did determine whether that was per room or per computer. Lastly, they didn't charge us for it anyway. I would have refused to pay because it was s-l-o-w! Still, that was our only complaint. Great location, comfortable bed, good shower, nice furnishings, not a big-box chain, pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Another Generic”
Reviews.Author: xpcv
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel - it's not perfect, but it's got an old world attitude that I found quirky. The furnishings and appointments are lovely. Security was good. I was a little taken aback by the cost of the valet parking, but the $26 is for your entire stay, not per night as another reviewer thought. Their system for internet access definitely needs to be brought into the 21st century. And I'm not paying to use your crappy internet system; the request for payment to connect was just insulting. I also found the TV system exceptionally primitive - why have flat screens if you don't receive an HD signal? But staff were efficient, location good, and in general I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good with a few constructive suggestions”
Reviews.Author: missjennymarie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at this hotel. Overall, the stay was enjoyable. The room was small but in a cozy way. We didn't use the sitting room for anything but a place to toss our coats. The bathroom was a sufficiant size. The walk in shower was nice. Great selection of Aveda amenities. Only a few criticisms to note during our stay: -Valet Parking at $26/day? Rediculous. Thankfully it is somewhat central to a lot of transportation hubs...but when you really don't feel like walking to the sky train or sea bus in pouring down rain, having to get your car out of Valet is always a nuissance. Why does it feel like you're inconviniencing the valet for your own vehicle? Offer a self park option for a slightly lower rate (or discount with the large parking garage just down the street). -Internet was touchy. It basically worked when it wanted to work, which is always really annoying when you're trying to find out local information and not wanting to bother with using concierge. -Customer Service was lacking in the friendly sense...which was a huge disappointment. Perhaps its common across all 'boutique' hotels, but not having a valet smile when you hand over your keys, or a front desk agent all but ignore you when checking you out of the hotel is annoying. We only had one encounter with a friendly staff member. Everyone seems to hate their job and resent you for making them work. Peculiar. Overall it was a nice enough hotel. Not the best, but better than the worst by far.

Reviews.Title: “friendly & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: harriet_deborah_vane
Reviews.Content: Room was cozy and well decorated. Food available in room for purchase (though expensive by my budget). Very very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Life Under The Big Top”
Reviews.Author: SukiJamma
Reviews.Content: This was a cool room with a great location. Parking was pricey but I'm afraid that's true of any big city hotel. The staff was really friendly and genuine. It made me want to come back and explore more of Vancouver. We were really pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scrapyardnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel at the beginning and end of our very long road trip and found it excellent, not just value for money compared to other downtown hotels, but it has such a nice atmosphere and the staff are genuinely friendly, none of the smarmy 'have a nice day' crap you get at some big chains. The rooms were cozy and quiet, in fact we stayed in 10 hotels during our trip and we had the best nights sleep here, so peaceful and the beds are sooo comfy. I must admit the decor was a bit over whelming at first, the rooms are not small at all, theres plenty of room, just a great hotel and I will definately return next time I'm in Vancouver, loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as expected.”
Reviews.Author: fulstoneflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le Soleil for 3 nights. We chose it because of Tripadvisor reviews. We were somewhat disappointed with the size of the rooms. The separate sitting area was very small and the furniture not very comfortable. We were not happy having to pay for WiFi. Why do hotels insist on charging for such a basic amentity,

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, our favorite hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Gamergirl9949
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this review by saying that my family and I have been staying at Hotel Le Soleil for our trips to Vancouver for years now. We usually stay in the corner king bedroom suites, but have also stayed in the one bedroom suites. The staff is consistently friendly, courteous and helpful. Even though it's usually over a year between times we stay, the staff remembers us. I think it's a testament to the quality of a hotel when so many of the staff continues to work there for years. The room set up is ideal for us as a family. My two little ones sleep in the main 'living room' area on the sofa bed and we use the seperate bedroom. The bed is ridiculously comfortable and the rooms are quiet. We've never had any issues with noise in any of the rooms we stay in. The towels are thick and luxurious and the room has just about anything we could need. Love the flat-screen tvs! We couldn't ask more location-wise. It's an easy walk to most downtown Vancouver attractions and shopping and a skytrain station is less than half a block away for easy access to others. I'd also highly recommend the restaurant next door, 'The Copper Chimney.' Even though it's obviously not a family restaurant, they've been incredibly courteous readily accommodated our off the menu requests for the kiddos....and the food is fantastic! This restaurant is the one that does the room service for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: RainCityDog
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and tasteful. Visited with my Mother in Law and really liked having two televisions and especially two thermostats! We loved being so close to the Art Museum and Robson street, and agree with all the positive comments already posted on this site. Front Desk is exceptional. The housekeeping crew is friendly and the room was immaculate however, we did not have soap the first day and then the washcloths gone the next. Minor issues resolved quickly. Not all corner suites are as nice as the photos posted. Ours only had one window that got light or had a view which made it seem much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel great service”
Reviews.Author: bsharp1957
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the attention to detail and decor of the hotel. This is a boutique hotel in downtown. We were taking an Alaska cruise and it was close enough to walk our bags down to the dock. It was also close to a lot of fun things to do such as Chinatown, Robson St, Stanley Park and Gastown.

Reviews.Title: “No WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Intlpvti
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel but for the lack wifi. They charge you for slow and unreliable connection. I complained and they took it off the bill and seemed to be rightly embarrassed. For me, this is a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcl417
Reviews.Content: We selected Le Soleil after reading the reviews on trip advisor. It really is a very comfortable luxury boutique hotel in a very central location in down town Vancouver. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definetly come back here again if visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vancouver, we picked the right hotel - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SamLouise67
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Soleil was a wonderful hotel to stay in. It was mine & my husband's first time in Vancouver as part of a BC tour and I'm so glad we picked this as our first stop. When we arrived after a very long flight from the UK and a run on the 'Sky train' from the airport, the hotel staff were extremely polite and helpful (I even managed to have a chuckle with one member of staff from Germany about the world cup as they'd just beaten the UK 4-2!) We were informed that we'd been upgraded from a double room to a one bedroom suite at no extra charge which was a lovely start to our holiday. We stayed in a corner suite, number 1002. Our suite was gorgeous. Very clean, very well laid out, beautiful furniture and decor. There was a big TV in the main area and also one in the bedroom, not that we used them much but handy for the weather channel! Big variety of drinks from tea, coffee, water, soft drinks, beer, wine and also lots of different nibbles to choose from (obviously at a cost) Nice roomy bathroom with a shower over the bath. I'm pretty sure the previous reviewer didn't pick up their 'bugs' at the Soleil because my husband I were bitten half to death throughout our three weeks in Canada no matter where we stayed (and we stayed in 8 different hotels!) or what activities we took part in so for other potential customers reading that review, I'd take it with a pinch of salt. The concierge were very helfpul, answering all of our questions and drawing on a map some of the best places to visit and eat. Just what we needed for our first day! I can't comment on the restaurant as we didn't eat there (such erratic hours we kept, lol) but I will give the hotel 10/10 for everything else. Thank you Hotel Le Soleil for a lovely start to our travels in Canada :o)

Reviews.Title: “Not really a boutique hotel, but was centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: book_junkie
Reviews.Content: Eek, I see the "Bedbugs" review and I am surprised about that as our rooms were very clean. Hotel Le Soleil is very centrally located for quite a bit of sightseeing in Vancouver, The rooms were a little small, and I was very aggravated that Wireless Service was an additional $9 a day particularly since it is promoted as a business hotel. Anyway, it was a good value' the front desk was helpful, but I would look elsewhere for our travel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: torch1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a technical short course, and although I was very happy with the service, the location, and the price, I was rather disgusted to find I was sharing my bed with bedbugs. I woke up one morning with four bites on one leg, and two bites on the other. I know that the West End is suffering from a bedbug infestation, but I never expected the hotels to be infested too. I would stay somewhere in the Kits/Broadway area if I stayed in Vancouver again. The bits healed after 10 days or so, but I've been paranoid ever since.

Reviews.Title: “Le Soleil very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TINSELTX
Reviews.Content: I always prefer a boutique hotel and since we've stayed in several of the larger chains in Vancouver I thought I'd give the Soleil a try. The hotel is a cute little place. It's charming railroad car style ground floor entrance, complete with twinkling lights is a nice change from the large lobby approach. All staff was very pleasant and attentive. We found the location to be very convenient for our purposes. Three blocks downhill to Canada Place, which makes it great for cruisers. There's a variety of shop and restaurants around the block, anything you needed was well within walking distance. You'll find the Pacific Mall a few blocks away. The hotel has a lovely little restaurant connected to the lobby that serves a nice breakfast. On the corner is The Keg. We enjoyed surf and turf there for dinner. Again, staff was very attentive and kind. The hotel in room wifi, can be a bit confusing - you have to call down to the front desk to get a code. Rooms are small by US standards but comfortable. Decor, well, everyone has their own taste and the pictures are dead on accurate as of this date. A bit too much gold for me but again, it was very comfortable. And best of all, it was quiet! Not a sound from the hallway or from any walls or ceiling. Just like you were the only ones in the place! Compared to subsequent hotel stays on this trip, this turned out to be the quietest hotel we experienced- a quality that can be lost on you until you have a few sleepless nights due to an evening filled with clearly experiencing hall conversation of strangers and repeated loud door slamming! Not here. No noise. No overheard conversations. No noisy slamming of doors. Blissfully peaceful in the middle of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fussyyetcheap
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times but never provided feedback. I guess that is because I'm usually here on business and this time I travelled with my spouse for a vacation. This is a very quiet, very clean hotel with super friendly staff and a unique ambience. In addition every room in the hotel is a suite with a small sitting room and a separate bedroom. Each time I have checked price, this hotel seems to be in the same range as other 4/5 stars in the area. I'll stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Hitt & Miss”
Reviews.Author: roseoakhil
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our 3 week trip to Canada, staying 4 nights in Vancouver. I had originally booked the Marriott Pinnacle but with the exchange rates not in our favour at all the week before I took a look on expedia & booked this hotel at a saving of £200 compared to Marriott & looking at tripadvisor this was far better quality. When we arrived on a very rainy night in may after our 10 hour flight we had a very warm welcome from the front of house staff, however there were plenty of times when the welcome wasn’t so warm as our 1st (staff our a bit hit 7 miss). Our room on the 9th floor was very nice, you walked in to the seating area with TV & sofa (to be honest we never used this area at all) then through to the bedroom. I have mixed feeling on the décor, its fine in a hotel but it is bordering on citshe. Apart from the plush themes of the room there isn’t really anything to rave about in compassion to any other hotel room. We did have a nice view from the side window down to Canada Place. Despite being advertised with free wifi it doesn’t have (I think previous guests have mentioned this) you have to pay $8.95 (I think) per 24 hours, however the concierge did tell us there our 2 computers on the 3rd floor we could use for free but I couldn’t find them. The hotel does I’ll be honest seem to want to charge for everything on top, I asked if I could get milk on arrival to make tea in my room & I was told there may be a charge!! The hotel didn’t include breakfast in the price but we didn’t really want to venture far 1st thing in the morning for food so ate in the hotel restaurant anyway for breakfast, food is great, filled us up for the whole day but be warned expensive! About $40 for 2 hot breakfasts, 1 orange juice & 1 tea, oh and if you don’t like the combinations of sausages, eggs etc and request to swap something you have to pay a substitution charge! Little things like this put me off this hotel somewhat. The best thing about the Le Soleil is the location, its so easy to get everywhere from the hotel. I would recommend this to other people but id also say there our better hotel to stay at in Vancouver, Le soleil just lacks something which im inclined to say is any kind of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for our Brief Stay”
Reviews.Author: hampshirecruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver for 2 nights following an Alaska Cruise. The hotel is well situated and is easy walking distance from the cruise terminal in Canada Place as long as you can manage your luggage. We arrived at 10:00 am and received a friendly, helpful greeting with "Let's see if we can find you a room that's ready now". The receptionist did and we were able to go straight in to our room. I should say suite as the rooms are suites with separate lounge, bathroom and bedroom. The bedroom can be shut off from the lounge and both rooms have a large flat-screen TV.
