Nice big comfortable bed, excellent bathroom facilities, good lounge with 2 seater settee, an armchair and coffee maker. Excellent food in the hotel restaurant the Copper Kettle, which we used for breakfast. We also enjoyed dinner twice in the Keg restaurant on the corner of the block. The Concierge was also very helpful in arranging a trip for us to go to Whistler - up on a float plane and down on the Rocky Mountaineer train. Everyone was very friendly and there is free WiFi or free use of a computer in the business room. Altogether a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great cozy hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Merlin081
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night when we attended Stars on Ice at GM Place. The hotel is easy walking to GM Place and Yaletown restaurants -as well as cruise ships and all downtown shopping. No need to use the car. We didn't need the two televisions but can see how they would solve the problem of one person wanting an early night and the other needing to unwind watching TV. The sitting area was very comfortably furnished. The service was excellent -tea with fresh milk arrived even though the restauant/room service was closed - and the front desk staff was knowledgeable and friendly. To top it off the breakfast eggs Benny were perfectly cooked. The 3 pm check in and 12 noon check out also made our visit more rela xed. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great! Location is Perfect as well.”
Reviews.Author: Stasus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Le Soleil 6 times now and every time is the same, fantastic. Nestled in the heart of downtown it is literally steps from everything. The rooms are clean, sizable and very comfortable and the staff is second to none. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value theme hotel, with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: JL99
Reviews.Content: After receiving a very good rate for 3 nights at this hotel, and based on the positive reviews, I decided to stay here based on the location. The location is very central - right in the heart of the commercial area of downtown Vancouver. It is a business area and there aren't many places nearby for a snack or a cheap meal on the weekend... you'll have to walk a few blocks for anything during non-business hours, but things are still that far. It is 2 blocks to the SkyTrain. It can be a bit noisy late at night from a few nearby bars...but this may be unavoidable in downtown Vancouver. This hotel advertises itself as a 4 star hotel...it comes close, but it's better described as a theme hotel. The hotel has a Louis XIV(French Sun King) motif that is a bit over the top - with golden sun logos everywhere and a phony ornateness on a level that can make one feel out of place at first. If the rooms were in the layout of a conventional hotel room, they would be quite large, spacious and comfortable. They're not though... the bathroom/closet/bar area is in the centre of your living space - dividing it in two, leaving you with a small living room area and a separate very small bedroom area. If you like a large hotel room, this would not be a good choice. The bedroom area is barely large enough for two single beds or one queen sized bed. This works well if you're there by yourself or a close couple, but not so well otherwise. Both tiny rooms feature 42 inch flat screen TVs...which sounds great, but both rooms are also too small for such large displays - especially when they don't have HDTV, making the picture quality look pretty horrible. The bathroom was elegantly decorated, though it only had a shower - no bath tub. I find it odd that a 4 star hotel would only have a shower. The bar area had a kettle in addition to a coffee maker...as well as hot chocolate, which non-coffee drinkers will appreciate! You can also use the mini-bar fridge to keep your own drinks cold. For all of the quirks, everything was in good condition and very clean. Free wireless internet is a huge plus as well - though I didn't try it. The service from the front desk and the maids was good - we were up to our room very quickly on check in, and all of the other workers always greet you with a smile and a hello...makes you feel welcome. Overall, I would stay here again for a good rate, especially if I was by myself or with my partner. I would not recommend this hotel to families with kids, or for anyone bothered by small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Economical”
Reviews.Author: JDincalif
Reviews.Content: This is a very classy hotel that is rather tucked away in the central financial district of town. The Le Soleil is relatively new but it was built with an early 20th century artistry. The lobby is warm and plush and our room was equally attractive and comfortable. The staff was very courteous and friendly. The location of the hotel was perfect for us as we like to walk and the concierge was very helpful by giving us advice as to the best walking routes around the city. We look forward to a return visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel if you are visiting Vancouver for Business”
Reviews.Author: TransferLady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not too costy, small, quiet and they have great service. There is a separate closed space in the rooms so if you want to watch TV at night, you will not disturb your spouse since it closes off with pocket doors. It's elegantly designed in gold tones and nicely set up. There is wireless access that even goes down to the Copper Chimney (wonderful food) restaurant below. The service is top notch and they are very helpful with reservations, travel arrangements etc. It's very close to everything you require and not far to walk for businesss meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Amongst the Big Boys”
Reviews.Author: LRJ13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Soleil is exactly that, if you want to get away from the what I call the "big boys" of the hotel world Hyatt, Sheraton, Marriott, etc. etc. This is a great place to stay. The location is pretty good, while it is centrally located in downtown it is kind of tucked away from the hub bub of all the nightlife so there's a great balance between feeling in the middle of downtown and yet have some distance form it. The shopping center in downtown is just a few minutes walk, and so is Robson street, the Vancouver Art gallery, and there is a Tim Hortons just a few block away which is a major plus. The Staff was friendly, and very knowledgeable, they help make the hotel a great one. All the rooms in the hotel are suites, it was huge it had a bedroom separate from the sitting room. There was free wifi in the hotel which is another plus because even the chains don't have that. The bed it self was big and comfortable. Overall this is a small, quaint, and charming little hotel with great value and good location, so it's a great alternative to the chain hotels this is THE place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shaz_aussie39
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, both times in December and found it charming. Friendly staff, superb location within walking distance to everything. The decor is sumptuous and elegant and the beds extremely comfortable. There are restaurants very close and shopping as well. The food in the restaurant is great if you feel like staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but One Thing”
Reviews.Author: mypreciouskids
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this hotel as soon as we entered our room. Very clean, nice, modern, very comfy bed & pillows, 2 flat screen TVs, a clean sofa bed, AC, friendly and helpful staff. Free internet connection, too. But there was no signal in our room, so we had to use a cord provided by the hotel for free. We stayed for 2 nights. The only issue is the parking fee, it's CAD$22/night. Quite expensive just for parking, not to mention the tips to the guys who helped us with the valet. Anyway, we'll come back here again when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: ORRNTOBE
Reviews.Content: After the 8hours to get to VAN via Amtrak this hotel was a wonderful surprise. Great shower head and pressure, very comfortable bed with cushiony pillowtop that I want for home (yes, I took the linens offf to check it out!!) Great location!! Service was okay- no bellman service when we arrived or departed, they didn't hold the door at all and no driving service to the station- my husband thought this should have been the case for this hotel and I could have used help with the doors. Other than that - stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel20
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went for a girl's weekend to Vancouver Dec 4 - 6 and were amazed with the service that this hotel offered us. We are not too familiar with Vancouver, so we asked the front desk alot of questions and they were able to reccomend many different restaurants, and even places for us to go for drinks before having a meal. We indicated interest in one restaurant and the concierge was on the phone right away making us a reservation, without us having to ask. The staff did everything and anything they could to make our stay and vacation enjoyable. The location of this hotel is ideal as it is very close to many different attractions and shopping in downtown Vancouver - and we were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go. We have already decided that on our trip next year, we are definately staying at this hotel as the people were so friendly and helpful. I highly reccomend this hotel for anyone going to Vancouver as nothing we asked for was too hard for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Fan
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the internet and was taking a chance on it? What a wonderful surprise to find that it was perfect and everything that it promised! Great location in the perfect part of Vancouver,enjoyed the separate living room and bedroom with 2 TV's. Within easy walking of nice places to eat,shop and sightsee. I would go back and stay here again if I go to Vancuover again! That sums it up! Lovely decor too.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: noirbidu
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is located in downtown Vancouver within a couple of blocks from shopping on Georgia and Robson streets. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was upgraded to a gorgeous corner king suite. The room was a wonderful surprise. The restaurant next door (The Chimney Pot) that provided room service was great. Try the Le Soleil Chicken. I will definitely stay here when I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sleepyamie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Le Soleil for a romantic evening away and I'm so glad we chose this hotel! The decor is just amazing, I loved the European vibe! We were checked in promptly! The front desk staff was quick,polite and helpful! Not at all snobby like you sometimes find downtown! We stayed in a Corner Suite and it was beautiful! We had a great view and the bed was so comfortable! The hotel was so quite we felt we were the only guests there! The Aveda bath products are always a plus! The only things we disliked were the cheap 1 ply toilet paper! Funny thing to skimp on in such a nice hotel. We also found the valet drives very rude/un-professional. Not the greatest feeling when leaving your vehicle with them! Other than that we'll hopefully return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: BozoHoser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight when I traveled to Vancouver for a business meeting. We were given an upgrade to a suite which was a bonus but the big surprise was how nice the hotel was, the rooms were beautifully decorated with huge flat screen TVs and an awesome bed. Next morning's room service breakfast was delivered in less than $20 minutes. All the staff were extremely helpful and the free wi-fi was well appreciated. Definitely going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel at an amazing price”
Reviews.Author: tythetraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and loved every minute we were there. With the poor weather outside the comfortable sitting area in the lobby provided a welcome reprieve with great chairs and sofas and a beautiful fireplace....a great place to sit and read a book or newspaper (free with stay). The hotel is also perfectly situated for the Vancouver visitor. Robson Street is 3 blocks away with many great shops and restaurants, and an 8 block walk up Hornby gets you to the water taxis to Granville Island and the incredible markets there. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and were eager to provide any information to make our stay better. The Website booking was also great, with a quick website which had better prices than any of the budget travel websites. The only slight downsides would be that the rooms were a touch small, and they only offer valet parking, but these were minor in comparison to the great stay we had. As someone to travels to Vancouver several times a year for weekend getaways I wouldn't stay anywhere else now.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Soleil Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sedona08
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vanvouver for a short getaway with friends. Researched hotels through Tripadvisor and found Hotel Le Soleil to be centrally located downtown. Although within walking distrance to popular sites, tourists should plan on walking several blocks. Accommodations were clean, secure, quiet, and exactly as described by former reviewers. The quarters were small compared to standard hotels but this was not a surprise as reviews indicate that it is a boutique hotel and hence, the rooms are not as spacious. The service was professional, however, our needs were minimal. Guests will need to use the hotel valet service if they do not want to walk to distant parking lots and remember to account for a daily parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Central”
Reviews.Author: benders
Reviews.Content: After annual visits to Vancouver in the past three years and having stayed at the comfortable contemporary Delta Vancouver Suites, I decided to try a different hotel on this occasion. I was taking some leisure time en route to a Conference in Seattle. The Hotel Le Soleil was chosen following a visit to the Trip Advisor web site and recommendations of other guests. I was not disappointed. A quiet non-smking room was requested and provided. The room (sitting room, bedroom, and bathroom was well maintained and equipped. It was moderately sized and comfortable. The check-in service and luggage storage at the end of my stay was friendly and efficient. While the hotel is very popular at weekends, the level of service was consistent. While the accommodation was reasonably expensive, I believe that this quality hotel was worth the cost and would recommend it as a centrally situated, comfortable, upper range place to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: chattercafe
Reviews.Content: Two friends, my sister and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights before a cruise through the Alaskan Inside Passage. We had 2 suites and thought they were great! Very nicely decorated and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. They were always ready to answer questions and even willing to give suggestions on where to eat. We will definitely stay there again when we return o Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic value in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: rwb2
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed here for a night after disembarking an Alaska cruise. The hotel is very close to the pier. Not much in the way of dining or nightlife in this neighborhood but the Copper Chimney Restaurant downstairs was fairly good. Great service, attentive concierge. Tastefully furnished rooms, 2 huge flat-screens, and a large shower. We had a true suite so the kids could sleep on a hide-a-bed. We rested very well. Very close to Gastown and Stanley Park. Not the cheapest option but a fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to waterfront, walk to Stanley Park, near mall”
Reviews.Author: maverick_cp
Reviews.Content: We were taking our son to college. First time in Canada. This hotel was great - we had a separate twinned bedroom from the living room. Elegant yet homey with complimentary apples and water!!! Front desk was very helpful and provided me an awesome running trail which took me through the beautiful Stanley Park. A block or two from the iconic ship terminal (big white tented building.) We were close to Gastown (fun nightspot) as well as Granville Island (public market had the most outstanding gourmet-quality food at inexpensive prices compared to eating in a restaurant!! and you can kayak under the bridge there!!) There was also a lot of retail shopping a block away so we were able to get our son his mobile phone - and a ton of banks - so we could set up his bank account! We were really close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique Hotel in good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: crazyed
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 1BR corner suite on the 5th floor, booked over the internet. Very elegant decor in a good location close to Canada Place but beware the one way roads! In room dining was pricey but there is a good Keg restaurant close by which we used. The room was very comfortable for 2 people and inclusions first class (except no slippers!). 5th floor views were non existent but the light coming in the windows was excellent. Minibar to die for, not much left to chance for a midnight snack. We used this as a base to explore Vancouver and found it pretty much ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect.”
Reviews.Author: JoseSchwartz
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific place to stay in downtown Vancouver. We had a very comfortable two-room suite with two (count 'em, two!) flat screen TVs, Wi-Fi, and plush appointments for about $179 per night midweek through Saturday night. The hotel is within walking distance of Robson Street, the West End, Gastown and Chinatown. It's one of the nicer hotels I've stayed at, with a very pleasant, professional staff and an overall feeling of class. One caveat: as far as I can tell, there are no rooms with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jojicat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night but wish it had been for longer. Great location and lovely suite. Luxurious bathroom with double shower but no bath. Friendly and helpful staff. One of the few hotels to offer free wi-fi in rooms. This influenced us when booking with them. Also had use of business centre for no charge when we needed to print our boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay if you want to stay in and watch TV. Good for families with one child.”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerLondon
Reviews.Content: The lobby was buzzing when I arrived at Le Soleil. The people in front of me were switching from another downtown hotel. Check in was efficient and I was soon in my room/suite. The room had its own tiny sitting room (together with a 45 inch tv) and a tiny bedroom, also with a 45 inch tv and a comfortable firm king sized bed. Furnishings are in the Biedermeyer style: lots of gold including the stripes in the wall paper. The bathroom had a large walk in shower but I would have preferred a bath, an option I was not given. Amenities were Aveda which I think are over rated The hotel is a few blocks away from Canada Place but there is not much happening in the immediate vicinity and the view from my room was over the street (quite noisy) and the adjacent YWCA. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was average. However the general experience was quite favourable and it made a nice change from some of the other tired properties in the city.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as Expected”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We had a really good rate from a promotion but I would still say there is good value here. If you want to experience a modern European hotel in North America stay here. Super location. Good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vancouver Experience”
Reviews.Author: Neutra
Reviews.Content: We visited for 4 nights in July 2009 - we were attending a family wedding. Our room was ready when we arrived - which is always a good sign! We looked at each other and laughed when we saw the lovely lobby and elevators - we were so thrilled that we had chosen such a lovely place. But that's not all, the room was incredible, a junior suite which was quiet and contemplative. Room service was excellent and the wonderful lobby staff made certain we got a taxi to Richmond for our nephew's wedding. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend LeSoleil and I will definitely return there on my next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and comfortable, staff was very helpful”
Reviews.Author: FS97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights (8/20-8/24/09) and again on 8/31. We arrived early and our room was not ready due to a maintenance problem with the air conditioning. They offered us another room but we said we would wait for the suite we wanted. When we got to the room there was a bottle of wine and a letter of apology for making us wait. The staff also made suggestions of places to dine and things to do. The hotel restaurant is very good. The "Keg " is 1/2 block away, also good. Our favorite was a place called "Scoozis", a block and 1/2 from the hotel. The staff can give you directions. As the hotel is in the financial district it is fairly quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lois_u
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Le Soleil before going on our Alaskan Cruise. The staff was EXCELLENT! They were very helpful and gave us lots of information on boarding our ship. The room was clean and very comfortable. The staff was always willing to help with everything we needed. We would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected . . . and I expected a lot.”
Reviews.Author: Kingpin26
Reviews.Content: I agreed with most of the other reviews in Trip Advisor but this small hotel in Vancouver's Center actually exceeded my expectations. I stayed here nine consecutive nights, so I got a very thorough experience. Location was great for the Center, easy walking distance to shopping, Canada Center, the river ferries, Gastown. While on a busy streeet, the room was quiet and confortable. Quick service from a friendly staff. Free ireless internet connection was OK. Great valet parking, although pricey. Any real complaints? Not really. The adjacent restaurant was so-so in a city with some very good competition, but it was only a short walk to lots of other good ones. The prices on the mini-bar and snacks were so high, I thought it must be a mistake, but it wasn't. However, a good market is close by if you need anything more than a Coke or a beer. Overall, a good value in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel, Comfy Beds, Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: Raybeam76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Soleil in a corner suite for 4 nights. We checked in late and Cory courteously moved our room to a higher floor at my request. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in at any hotel. The room was spotless and houskeeping did an excellent job every day in keeping it that way. The rooms are all suites with two rooms. The furnishings are very comfortable and both the bedroom and the living area are equipped with a 42" LCD flat screen television. The hotel provides free wireless internet and a refrigerator in the room. Parking was only $22 per day. Compared to the other high end hotels in the area this is excellent. The hotel does not have workout facilities or a pool. This is not an issue for me because I don't go on vacation to workout in a gym. Walking around is my exercise when on vacation. There is a very nice YMCA next door. I saw an olympic sized pool when walking by the Y. The service was awesome. Every person in the hotel was extremely friendly. The staff went out of their way to assist in any way to make our stay more pleasant. Brett, the concierge suggested some excellent restaurants based on our dining preferences. Adam, Chris and Patrick were also very corteous. They would ask what time I wanted them to have my car ready, suggested which place to buy a cuban cigar, which lounge to go to and they provided excellent driving instructions. I never got the feeling that the staff was fishing for or expecting a tip. The guys were extremely professional. The front desk people were also extremely courteous and helpful. The hotel provides free bottled water and apples as a courtesy. Nice touch. We received great value for the money. I booked when they were having a special and received a very favorable rate. This is a solid 4 star hotel. The only negatives are the rooms are a bit small. We tend to live out of our suitcases when we travel and only one would fit in the bedroom. The other was on the floor in the living area. There is a large closet in the hall between the living area and bedroom. So if you unpack your bags there is enough room to store your suitcase in the closet. If it matters to you the lack of a free workout facility and a lounge with entertainment are the other negatives. There are other lounges that provide jazz or piano entertainers within a few blocks of the hotel. There isn't a great view from the rooms since it is only 14 or 15 floors. My room looked at the Hyatt and a TD Bank building but ince again I do not go on vacation to look at the view from my hotel room. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. The hotel is not smack in the middle of the shopping district (Robson and Burrard) but only a couple of short blocks away. So the hotel provided us with quiet enjoyment with the action only three blocks away. I would suggest using the hop on hop off bus tour. It takes you to various parts of interest in the town and you can get on and off for one 2 day fee. There is a great little breakfast place on Howe Street (one block over) next to Marios Coffee. Make a right out of the hotel, cross the street toward Howe. At Howe make a left down the street nad the breakfast place is on the left. It looks like a hole in the wall from outside but the place is clean and breakfast is very good for a reasonable price (Less than $20 including tip for 2). Catch a sunset at Prospect point in Stanley Park. Have a meal at the fish house in Stanley Park. The Salmon is awesome anywhere you eat in Vancouver and I am not a huge salmon fan. Check out Gas Town and the Sun-Yet Sen Garden. Both places are very worth seeing. Hope this helps future travellers to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this sophisticated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LizzieTexas
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! The building has the feel and appearance of a grand hotel from the 1930s. but it was actually built around 10 years ago, providing the best of both worlds. The front desk staff and concierge were friendly, took the initiative to offer suggestions, and were attentive to all the guest. We had a deluxe king studio with an excellent bed, large bathroom, and decent closet space. The hotel was very quiet - we didn't hear any inside or outside noise. The housekeeping service was exceptional, although we never saw a service cart. We tried the restaurant, which was passable; with so many other amazing dining options in the city, I'd recommend skipping it. The only other drawback is the lack of fitness center - paying $11.00 per day to use the YWCA wasn't very appealing, but we got plenty of exercise exploring Vancouver. All in all, this was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HB1964
Reviews.Content: I had the most horrendous journey from the UK arriving in VC 8 hours later than I should have (2am). the only high point of the whole journey was arriving in reception dog tired to be met with a smiling concierge who had upgraded me after my partner had mailed them to let them know I was going to arrive in the middle of the night. It was a shame to have a suite all to myslef but will defintiely stay here again next time I visit VC. The Concierge really is that. The business centre staff are also really helpful. It has a small hotel feel with each guest being attneded to as if you are the most improtant person in the world. the only down side was the breakfast - very good but so it should at that price!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Charming in the Heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 415traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Soleil for three nights with a friend in one of the corner suites. We requested two beds, but unfortunately, none of those rooms were available when we arrived. Even so, our room was essentially a small one-bedroom suite with a queen size bed in one room and a pull-out sofa bed in the living room. My friend slept on the sofa bed and thought it was good, not great. Overall, the set up was fine, but when the sofa bed was pulled out, you couldn't walk in the living room at all. Only a slight inconvenience. Our hotel room was a good size for us and was certainly comfortable, but a bit cramped with luggage and sofa pulled out, etc. The hotel has a small/boutique feel in the midst of a big city. The location is ideal, right in the middle of downtown and just a short walk to Gastown, the Art Gallery, Robson Street, etc. The front desk staff were welcoming and helpful. In fact, I had an emergency and needed to see a doctor on our second day and the front desk pointed me to the walk-in clinic next door (as opposed to the on call hotel doctor who charges $600 per consult). The only negative experience we had was with the internet. The free high speed internet was hard to access despite help from the front desk and multiple tries. And the TV internet was a joke, but what do you expect when accessing the internet through a TV?! We got a great deal for the room online and paid about $100 per night. For that price, the value was amazing. Very clean, centrally located, high end without being stuffy. I would pay more for the hotel, but I'm not sure it would compete with the big name high end hotels at its full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: smithsn02
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. The staff was very friendly & helpful. They offered to show where to eat and what to see as soon as we got there. Little bottles of water & fresh apples (all free!!) at the front desk were a nice touch. The room was very clean & modern. It had an upscale feel to it without the expensive price tag. Our family had two rooms and we were getting on a cruise ship the next day. They let us keep one room and check out late (around 1pm) so we could explore the city without dragging our bags around. The location was perfect. It was within 3 blocks of both the cruise ship terminal and the main street where shops & restaurants are. I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Bonniepippa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other traveller reviews and we wern't disappointed. The staff were particularly friendly and the room was great. Lots of space and beautifully decorated. The central location of the hotel meant that we could walk to the main shops including Pacific Mall and also walk to the harbour front. There is a very big tourist information just down the road from the hotel and the people are also very friendly and helpful there. If you are thinking of travelling on to Vancouver Island as we did, then why not travel by sea plane - this is what we did and the trip was amazing. We landed in the Inner Harbour of Victoria in 35 minutes. We were also able to walk down to the sea plane terminal from the hotel in Vancouver and then walk to our hotel when we arrived in Victoria. I would highly recommend Hotel Le Soleil and if I was going back I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location and the friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: GenericID
Reviews.Content: Having read all of this year's reviews, it would be most efficient to just say I concur with everyone else! This is a beautiful hotel and the staff makes you feel like you are at a small B&B, although it seemed like the entire city was brimming with the friendliest people around. There is a White Spot restaurant a few blocks away which was great family choice. Robson Street was in walking distance and that was great fun to see the street performers. Bike rentals were also close. We didn't get the car out the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! - A jewel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Tennisbum42
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel! Good location, attentive and helpful staff, charming hotel. The suites are well-designed and make good use of small spaces--operative word here, "small"; there may be only inches between the foot of the bed and the ornate table that holds the flat-screen TV. But the mirrored wall, huge windows, and well-laid-out floorplan give the illusion of greater space, and we were not at all inconvenienced. There is still an nice entrance hallway, cozy (but with adequate space) living room (with sleeper sofa) and a roomy, luxurious black marble bath. Great Shower. Robes were a plus. All in all, a great place to come back to after a day of sight-seeing. Highly recommended. We look forwarding to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver in Summer”
Reviews.Author: Seattle48
Reviews.Content: Nice location, quiet on the weekend, service was helpful and rooms were small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location with good size room and nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn_Lefty
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an awesome downtown location, right in the heart of downtown Vancouver. The bed was very comfortable, we had 2 large flat screen TVs in our room (one in bedroom and one in living area) and Aveda toiletry products. They offered free Wi-Fi as well. This was a great value for what we paid, since the nicer looking hotels (on TripAdvisor) were about 2x the price of this hotel. We were impressed and we would defenitely stay at Hotel LeSoleil again.

Reviews.Title: “A most excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a combination of business and fun. All I can say is that the hotel is beautful, the staff friendly and very helpful, the attached restaurant is excellent, and the room superb. It was much nicer than the large chain hotels. Definately worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: hypatia
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous little jewelbox of a hotel! Good location, attentive and helpful staff, charming hotel. When you first walk in, you may be a bit overwhelmed by the interior designers' Empire design (Napoleonic bees, Regency stripe, document fabrics, obelisks, etc., abound--along with the ubiquitous "soleil"--sunbursts everywhere, on nearly everything, from doors to coasters!); but even if you're not a fan, you can't help being drawn in. The suites are well-designed and make good use of small spaces--operative word here, "small"; there may be only inches between the foot of the bed and the ornate table that holds the flat-screen TV. But the mirrored wall, huge windows, and well-laid-out floorplan give the illusion of greater space, and we were not at all inconvenienced. There is still an nice entrance hallway, cozy (but with adequate space) living room (with sleeper sofa) and a roomy, luxurious black marble bath. All in all, a great place to come back to after a day of sight-seeing. Highly recommended, especially with Trip Advisor discount! :-) (In my opinion, though, not worth the "list" price.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sascha11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our 7 day Alaska cruise. Only a 10 minute walk from the terminal. This is a lovely hotel. Not huge, but very friendly staff. Loved the separate bedroom and lounge area. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel LeSoleil - Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: kerry0072
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended as the rooms have a lounge and separate bedroom area. The hotel is very central and convenient. The bathrooms are a nice size and have great showers. As we were jetlagged coming from England, we went to bed early and had no problems sleeping as it was very quiet. The starbucks opposite was very handy for an early morning coffee. The staff were friendly and we are returning for one night after our trip around British Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with our choice - Perfect boutique hotel at a great price and location”
Reviews.Author: JmSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Soleil this past weekend, and we were completely satisfied with our choice; here is why: -Great Location: The hotel is a few blocks (2-3 short ones) from the heart of Robson, which is the shopping district. -Pretty Hotel/Well Maintained: A perfect boutique hotel. Small, but georgeous lobby, well maintained rooms, well decorated, clean, character, etc. -Great Service: I am picky when it comes to service, and wI was impressed with every encounter that we had. The staff is friendly, cheerful, helpful and on the ball. -Great Price: We booked our room for $120 a night. Amazing bargain. Oh and Free WiFi! **TIP: I almost did not book this hotel since I could not get a king bed online. But we arrived early and were able to upgrade at no additional charge. Worth a call.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: SCCanuck
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels over the years and this is probably the best value I have ever received for the price paid. My son and I spent four nights here and we encountered friendly staff, excellent service, an immaculate room and good food all for just over one hundred dollars per night. How can I complain about the 20 dollars/night charge for the valet parking for the rental car! This was an unbelievable value. We pulled up to the hotel and were greeted by a friendly valet who assisted us with our bags and parked our car. The front desk clerk was pleasant and check-in was quick. As mentioned in previous reviews, this a small boutique hotel and the staff is minimal. Yet we never encountered any problems and just once did we have to wait for the vehicle to be parked, even then only for a minute or so. The suite is not the largest I have encountered but it was comfortable and certainly more than adequate. It was also spotless and the housekeeping staff did an excellent cleaning job each day. The entry from the hall is to the small sitting room, with 2 chairs and a small sofa. There are two 42 inch LG flat screen TV's, one in this room and one in the bedroom. The bathroom on one side of the hall and the closet on the other separate the sitting room from the bedroom. There is a safe large enough to hold a laptop computer in the closet. Bathrobes and an iron are also found in the closet. The bathroom has a marble counter and shower area. The counter space is not large but adequate. The shower is large and hot water is quick and abundant. My son took an extended shower after a day on the slopes and hot water was never an issue. The usual toiletries are supplied. The only complaint I can muster is the minimal lighting in the bathroom. It is not an issue for two guys but had my wife been with us and needed to apply makeup, I know it would have been an issue. The bedroom has a work desk: there is a phone on the desk and there is another potable handset next to the bed. While it cannot be considered a complaint, the decor is not to my liking. What is important after long days is the comfort of the beds and they were very comfortable. The property location is excellent. It is three blocks from the waterfront/Canada Place and there are many retail stores, hotels and restaurants within walking distance. There is no view to speak of as the hotel is surrounded by commercial properties but the view was not a consideration for us. Other hotels such as the Pan Pacific serve this purpose and charge accordingly. We ate room service the night of our arrival and the food was excellent and well priced. It was delivered quickly. The free internet did go down one morning and might have been an issue had this been a business trip. Otherwise the internet worked well and the speeds were acceptable. This hotel would have been a good value at a much higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: womanare
Reviews.Content: Clean, luxurious, excellent location and helpful staff. Great hotel at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: martymnm
Reviews.Content: I was not sure of the quality of this Hotel when I booked it then I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived, this is a very nice property and very well located in Downtown Vancouver. The room was decorated like a French B & B.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: wilsonjw
Reviews.Content: I found this downtown hotel through one of the prominent hotel-finding sites, and couldn't have been happier with the selection. We visited Vancouver on 24 December, so we were probably there during the "off season". Off season or no, the price was VERY reasonable, the rooms were wonderful, and the staff was exceptional. We stayed in a two-room suite with a great view. Each room had a temperature control, which made for comfortable sleeping. We didn't eat at the restaurant / bar, but it looked pretty nice. The hotel is walking distance from the many restaurants on Robson Street; that's where we ate breakfast in the morning. The hotel has valet parking available ($22CDN/night); street parking and parking garages are available nearby, if you choose to go that way. I heartily recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver. Unique Qualities: The feather bed was a nice touch. The overall decor of the room was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: RAW9
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travel Zoo as it offered an incredible deal. With so many choices for hotels in Vancouver, the Hotel Le Soleil ranks up there with the best. I stayed a week during the Christmas holiday. The hotel had lots of vacancies which made for a nice quiet peaceful stay. This added to the already superior level of customer service. I had more time to stop and ask for detailed directions and the best places to eat. If I did not stop to ask a question, the front desk staff would inquire as to whether I needed any assistance. I did not encounter any of the inconveniences that were reported in earlier reviews. Mind you, I am not that concerned if the internet is slow, or if I hear sirens from the street below. The room was large enough and was very clean. All amenities were in good supply. My main reason for staying there is because it is a boutique style property so there are not as many rooms as the larger hotel chains and you can be assured of a more intimate setting. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and it made my stay that much more enjoyable. The hotel restaurant offered a Christmas Dinner buffet and it was fantastic. The location of the hotel made it very easy to get around on foot, or by bus or sky train which are only a couple of blocks away. Consider the Hotel Le Soleil as a choice to stay for your next visit to Vancouver. I was completely satisfied with all that this hotel had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “ACDC Concert”
Reviews.Author: PeacePipe
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Staff are probably the most friendly I have experienced and more than willing to help. Close to good eats and shopping. The rooms were totally equipped if you forgot something. Our room had a living room and a bedroom kinda nice for a change. And they will even deliver ice to cool the beer. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: Our last 2 nights in Canada we stayed at Le Soleil chosen because of Tripadvisor reviews and situation in the city. We had a beautiful suite on the street side of the hotel on the 4th floor. Never heard any sound from other rooms, lift or people - it was very quiet. Six of us had dinner in the Copper Chimney - menu not huge choice, but what we had was excellent and the service was good too. Sitting around the log fire in the lounge after dinner we felt like we were at home. Reception staff were courteous, efficient and friendly. We will stay here again when next in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Desparately_seeking
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Soleil was lovely. Check on was warm, quick and we had a good room overlooking the big cross roads on Burrard. Rooms that have this view (and not of buildings/alley ways) are 9, 10 and 11. The room had a lounge area, minibar area off the bathroom and bedroom. I really liked this layout and the décor made me feel like I was in the Ritz in Paris. Bed was comfy with plenty of pillows, duvet and good quality sheets. Bathroom with huge shower and Aveda goodies (replenished every day) was superb. Tried the room service blueberry pancakes which were huge, delicious and arrived promptly and warm. Staff were helpful and friendly throughout the stay. I can see why this might not be to everyone's taste. I thought the décor was well maintained, but the layout is of a european style so rooms are smaller than most us traveller may expect. I loved it got a great rate if around £60 via hotels.co.uk. Can recommend Sciue round the corner for breakfast and lunch, the Keg on the corner was actually pretty good even though I was a bit snobby about it!

Reviews.Title: “as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: feduplivinginuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed there in oct 2007 ,and have to say was really quite good,the staff greeted us very well,we had a complimentary paper every morning,the room was fine,although yes the air con was a bit noisy,but nothing major,and yes we were taken aback by the price list for the mini bar, but we didnt need to use , the hotel is really well located for plenty of restraunts and breakfast bars, and for sightseening vancouver in general. It rained nearly every day of our week long stay there, and the staff couldnt be more helpfull in providing us with umbrellas,one of the reception guys was an aussie,so being brits we instantly hit it off with him, they even offered to arrange tickets for the canucks ice hockey game for us. vancouver is amazing you have to go see , especially grouse mountain on a clear day, unreal,was amazed at the amount of brit accents out there, everyone was really friendly , and can really recommend the KEG, which is a bar just round the corner from hotel, great staff, beer and food. would definately recommend the hotel , especially for location, and vancouver in general, cant wait to go back one day..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrTreLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sep 08 and found it was a good hotel. On check in they confirmed if we wanted a double or twin beds and on asking for a double weere upgraded to a corner suite - hard to complain! Hotel was well located and had everything we needed. Staff were okay - but really had little to do with them. Had breakfast at a cafe a five minute walk away across from the museum where there were about 3 cafes to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Most unhelpful staff I have ever encounterd”
Reviews.Author: Savonarola71
Reviews.Content: I have read some reviews praising this hotel staff and I have been astonished. Maybe there has been some kind of rotation, because the staff I encountered during my staying there was completely rude, unhelpful and inattentive to the guests’ requests. The point is that there were some misunderstandings concerning my credit card and on-line booking, and the front office desk, far from helping and solving the problems, reacted in an surprisingly rude and bad-mannered way. I don’t know the reasons for it, maybe they were inexperienced trainees , but the top was when they refused to give me a complaints form or allowed me to talk to the manager. In the end I was able to place the complaint, but I haven’t heard from this hotel ever since. I have travelled widely around the world and I have never seen a hotel so disrespectful regarding guests’ attention and handling of complaints. So my advice is avoiding for sure this hotel if you value guests’ treatment and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: atob
Reviews.Content: Le Soliel is just a gorgeous hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in early August. The location is excellent, a quick stroll to Robson street, canada place, gastown, coal harbour. It is about 20 minutes walk to Stanley Park and to the Granville Ferries. The room decor might not be to everyones taste, and I certainly wouldn't want my home decorated like that, but it kept with the ambience of the hotel and it was perfect. We had a corner 1 bedroom suite. The suite is divided into 3 rooms and a hallway. You have the bathroom, the lounge and the bedroom. Having each of these separate rooms does make it feel a little on the small side, but it was actually great to have the separate living area away from the bedroom. the rooms were immaculate, spotlessly clean and well organised. They were also very quiet. We had a family with kids staying next door and never heard a peep out of them the whole time. The bathroom was a good size and well fitted out with the best freebie toiletries selection! Aveda shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, lotion, mouthwash, cotton balls, sewing kit, Qtips, soaps...I forget what else but there was loads! We asked for an extra shampoo and showergel and housekeeping left us 3 of everything the next day! Now thats service! They also noticed that we had packets of tissues lying everywhere (we both were dosed with a flu) and they left us extra boxes of tissues in each room. I love these people! The front desk were amazing, very polite, extremely helpful and offering lots of local advice. They also have a basket of free bottles of water down there which was a nice touch. We didn't eat there, but did get wine, glasses, corkscrew and stuff sent up to the room. It arrived very quickly and with a smile. There is a good selection of treats and wine in the mini bar, and also some more 'adult' selections, which we thought were very funny, but they were very expensive, so we didn't try them out! I loved this hotel and when I am next in Vancouver will definitely be staying here. I wish all hotels were as good as this one. The staff deserve a medal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel with all its little touches is a great stay. The staff is extremely friendly and the rooms have most of the amenities. The rooms are decent size and the beds with feather pillows and comforters are very comfortable. The location is downtown so on the weekends there’s not much going on, but the city is small enough that you can find plenty to do within walking distance. I would have to say the only disappointment with the hotel is the slow internet access which at the end of our stay we were informed we could have obtained a cable to plug in the laptop. All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An all-around excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: travelbug4307
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely little boutique hotel last weekend and we both agreed it was just right. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and quiet, and the central location extremely handy. We also appreciated the complementary water and green apples at the front desk -- very handy. The room was not extremely large but not too tiny either. We slept well -- the bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning system was quiet (always a bonus in any hotel). My only complaint: my pet peeve is being placed in the room right next to or across from the elevator and Le Soleil placed us there. But I had to admit, it was extremely quiet, with very little coming and going, so it wasn't a big deal. But it bothers me that hotels always seem to place you in the least desirable location unless you request otherwise... On the whole, though, this is an excellent hotel, distinguished by professional and caring staff and I would have no hesitation recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “what a staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: hisim
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a little hard to find, but worth the effort! we had never before had a concierge order us a special, "on the house" appetizer after making our dinner reservation. the staff went over and above expectations. everyone is so well coached- from the maintenance man in the elevator to the valet parking the car. the rooms could use a little updating with their heavy bedspreads and drapes looking out of fashion, but we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Tomji
Reviews.Content: I agree with the recent posts. I paid $250/ night + taxes for the lowest tier of rooms available (tiny room, king bed only). The room itself was moderately dated, with an old-school bedspread (Note - Who uses bedspreads anymore? Everyone has white duvet covers now !!!). I was on the 9th floor and looked directly into the YMCA daycare next door. The service at check in was average - everyone was polite and nice but there was nothing outstanding about my experience. They had Aveda products in the rooms but the best part about this place is the location - it is close to everything, including Robson Street. At the same time, most of the major chains are located in downtown Vancouver and their location would be equally serviceable. I was disappointed by the lack of services available, all the while acknowledging that this is a "boutique" hotel. There was no internet and you had to pay to use the gym facilities at the YMCA next door. When I was asking for a good sushi restaurant, the girl at the counter referred me to a ghetto sushi place around the corner. All she had to do was tell me to go to Denman Street!! An average place for a fairly high price. If I were to do it again, I would just as soon book into the Westin or the Hyatt down the street, which are comparable in terms of prices. It was an alright hotel but don't go there expecting that it's THAT great. The previous posters who waxed eloquent about this place were off the mark about Hotel Le Soleil. That's my $0.02.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me but not one for all.....”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Soleil was pleasant but nothing spectacular. Again, was in town for business and wanted a downtown location. I had a deluxe room and it was spacious with a living room. Amenities are sparse - no room service or facilities (I arrived late in the evening and was fending for myself trying to find food - McD's 2 blocks away). Essentially, it's a bare-bones centrally located downtown hotel. The hotel is well situated downtown but be forewarned, it is about 4 doors down from a strip joint and massage palour (both are in the same building). It is important to note it is not a dodgey part of town but i wanted you to be aware of what's nearby... There is a Keg on the corner too (beside the strip joint). There is no gym but guests have access to a full service gym next door (although I believe the feeis $10). Overall, the hotel was reasonably priced and well located. I had to unexpectedly extend my trip another night and they were able to accommodate so that was very good of them on such late notice. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to others but if you're conservative, traveling with kids etc. I'd advise against b/c of what's a few doors down and b/c of the lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and without much in the way of amenities”
Reviews.Author: wisegambler30
Reviews.Content: Considering this hotel charges at it's high season a minimum of $300 per night it's rather amusing how people seem to rank this hotel up there with the likes of some of Vancouver's best places to stay. First of all, Le Soleil has practically nothing in the way of amenities beyond the standard concierge service, wireless internet access and a complementary news paper. This is increasingly the norm in every place you stay nowadays. The fitness centre they talk about next door requires you to pay out additional funds up to $12 per day so there is no deal to be had here whatsoever. In addition, hotel staff here leave something to be desired with most being rude and indifferent to hotel guests which I suspect is also due in part to the fact a separate operation called the Hornby Hotel operates in the same building. Neither Le Soleil or the Hornby Hotel seems to have reconciled their operations to the point where a guest who needed to use the baggage cart to remove quantities of luggage from their room couldn't do so because they weren't guests of Le Soleil. The result, the person had to haul nearly 6 pieces of luggage out of the place without the help of any of the hotel staff! I would recommend people shop around and stay somewhere else for the amount of money you'll spend here. For $300+ there are plenty of choices around town for the discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: swiattraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a Friday & Saturday night for a special occasion with my wife. We had a regular room (not a jr. suite or suite) and the room was a nice size and clean. The view wasn't great, looking out from the back of the building and over the back of a bistro behind the building, but we weren't expecting a view so that wasn't a large negative. We would occasionally hear large numbers of bottles being emptied into the dumpster and the trash collection (and we were over 5 floors up). The room has a wall paper pattern of vertical stripes, and while elegant, there were a couple of edges where it seemed to be slightly peeling, not exactly what I would expect in a hotel of this grade. As for service personell, the first bellman and valet I met upon checking in were very pleasant and professional, as was the front desk clerk, but not everyone maintained this professionalism. The front desk personell were attentive and professional (and assisted me with a dinner reservation when the concierge was not present). The bellman and car valet, not so much. I later called the front desk to inform them I needed to retrieve something from my car, and she said she would have th car brought up. The car was brought to the front and I retrieved what I needed from the car and was informed by the bellman if I needed to retrieve something from the car he could just let me into the private garage. I didn't argue with him that I had told the front desk clerk I only needed to retrieve something from the car. Additionally, when we were ready, I stood for a couple of minutes at the bellstand while the bellman and valet just talked outside (not helping any guests). When I walked out and got their attention to retrieve my bags (from checked storage) and my car (from the garage), the car was brought around well enough, but rather than bring the bags out to my vehicle (where I was standing), he just dumped them next to couch inside where my wife was sitting and didn't offer to bring them out the vehicle, etc. The best part of the hotel for me was definitely the central location and walking distance to many sites and restaurants, great since we are both explorers and enjoy touring cities by foot or using public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanslade
Reviews.Content: Situated in a very quiet location,10mins walk from cruise terminal and very handy for any sightseeing.Very friendly staff.Very clean,comfortable and spacious.We were upgraded to a corner suite,2 Queen beds,large TV in bedroom and lounge.Tea/coffie making facilities.Bakery and small deli nearby on the way to cruise terminal which was handy for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: hickmanaz
Reviews.Content: We had just finished a 14 day cruise to Alaska, pampered all 14 days and wanted a great finishing touch to our trip. Le Soleil did just that. The staff was professional and pleasant and went out of their way to answer any questions and point us in the right directions. The one-bedroom suite was enormous following a stay in a stateroom onboard ship. It was quiet and well appointed. Even tho the furnishings seemed a little "out-dated" I think they fit with the whole boutique look of the property. However, the "kama sutra" basket with condoms and lotions as well as oxygen to purchase was a bit much and had we had children with us would have caused many questions. Could do without those! Would definitely recommend to everyone, and have done so!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: tahoegolfer
Reviews.Content: convenient location - walking distance to the train station, shopping, great restaurants. Nice large walk in shower. Two bathrobes were available in the closet (a lot of hotels offer only 1). Wonderful, comfortable bed with pillow top, nice feather pillows, luxurious sheets. They had free wireless internet - however connection was spotty in places and I couldn't use my laptop in the living room area. I would have preferred better quality towels - although they were embossed towels they seemed rather thin. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No Sun @ Le Soleil for us....”
Reviews.Author: besitos
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe some of these reviews!Simply because our stay was a fiasco.The room & service at the front desk, ordering room service at dinner time was I was so rushed by whoever took the orders by phone, that of course what arrived was not entirely what we ordered.The concierge seemed busy , reading the paper as we passed by him to hail our cabs.Food was mediocre and service to rooms til 10pm.Last , but not least the "kama sutra"basket with condoms and lotions as well as oxygen to purchase , left me cold.I have never experienced this at The Four Seasons..wish we had stayed there, but the reason we did not was that we had stayed 6 years ago at Le Soleil, how time has changed what used to be a classy place! Make sure if you want a "do not disturb "on your phone to ask for it VERY clearly...I was awakened by a loud ringing phone 20 minutes after my request.The sun did not shine @Le Soleil for us.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The service is great and the property is fabulous! The decor is colorful and cheery -- what a treat. Good sized rooms; unlike some reviews below, I did not find the bed hard--it was just fine! Lovely linens and fine Aveda toiletries. I am so glad I found this hotel--I will stay here whenever I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Shining brightly at Le Soleil”
Reviews.Author: jnjmoore
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Le Soliel and will certainly not be my last. From the nicely appointed lobby with a couple of comfortable lounge areas to the fantastic one bedroom suite visitors are engulfed in chic Euro style. The staff was also to the European standards of excellence where hoteliers hold their professional positions as full careers. The hotel location was right in the middle of the city which was convenient for walking to most of my meetings but also nice for window shopping and going to one of the many fine coffee houses which seem to be every 20 feet. You cannot go wrong staying at this hotel, I highly recommend it. It fits well within the lovely city of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Le Soleil”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: A lot of charm and in the middle of everything. You can walk to Canada Place, Gastown or Robson Street all within 5-10 mins. maximum. A good safe location. For the price, a very good hotel. The rooms are broken up into bedroom, bathroom and living area. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The lobby is very attractive and the staff was very helpful. If you want to stay in downtown Vancouver, stay at the Le Soleil!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Europe”
Reviews.Author: Tooyoung4grandkids
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night because our daughter got married in Vancouver, didn't want to drive home late. Reviews for this hotel were great, the decor was very nice, makes you feel like you stepped into Europe, but I was a little disappointed. I paid extra to have a corner suite, which was very small, and had a dismal view of a narrow view of rooftop and aircons. The clincher for me, why I will not go back, was the amount of dust that wafted off the draperies when I moved them. Not a good sign of cleanliness policies! I did email the hotel about this, but did not receive a reply at all. So for all you people allergic to dust, don't go!!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: h2onab
Reviews.Content: There is a good reason Le Soleil is rated in the top 5 in Vancouver. A smaller hotel, close to the waterfront and Gastown, fair priced, with friendly, helpful service. The rooms are suite-like, bedroom, sitting room, 2 televisions, comfortable bathroom. There are special packages that make Le Soleil more affordable than many larger chain hotels. Highly recommended. Know that while Vancouver prepares for the 2010 Winter Olympics, visitors will encounter construction everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, a bit of attitude”
Reviews.Author: NYCBizTraveler24
Reviews.Content: Unique rooms, with lots of gilt trimmings and sitting areas. The hotel is in a good location and is a good value. The only irritation was the bit of attitude at the front desk - as if they were being troubled for what to me are normal questions.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Swimmy128
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to run up to Vancouver for the weekend. It was 2 days before Christmas and the hotel was decorated beautifully. Our room was not ready when we checked in. We only had to wait about 1/2 hour and it was not bad because we sat next to the fireplace in the lobby. The room was nice. Not big but not too small. It was long and a bit narrow. We had a sitting area with Tv and couch. The desk was in the bedroom. The mini bar had a very interesting assortment of items for sale. A can of oxygen. Never seen that before. The staff was very friendly and the price was good for a weekend in a big city. Very close to Robson street. Maybe a 5 min. walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romance Pckg for our Wedding Night!”
Reviews.Author: Mllover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20's. We splurged and stayed at Hotel Le Soleil for our wedding night in July 2007 and purchased the Romance Package in a 1-bedroom suite including valet parking, breakfast, turndown service, bottle of sparkling and chocolate strawberries on arrival, a "special gift" which included massage oils, and late 2pm checkout. It was FANTASTIC! Would recommend to anyone! I live in Vancouver and have always driven past this hotel and been breathlessly taken by the quaint and classy European look to the entrance and I just knew I wanted to stay there. It's in the business district downtown, safe and close to everything (mall, shopping, waterfront) but not lush and green like some parts of Vancouver. This is in the middle of the concrete jungle but a 5 minute walk to the water and views of mountains. The hotel and staff exceeded my expectations in every regard! I loved our stay at this hotel. It is immaculately clean, the room service breakfast was amazing (we had the blueberry pancakes, American breakfast and cafe mochas...the pancakes were the best I've ever had with tons of blueberries, and I'm picky!). The bed is soooo comfortable and the linens sparkling clean, with fluffy white duvet. We didn't want to get out of bed! And we loved the special turn down service with rose petals sprinkled in a heart shape on the bed. We used the petals to float in the bath, and we both just fit in the tub together. It was a deep soaker, but not huge. The decor implies French Provence, but is also modern, very nice. We had a large flat screen tv in the bedroom and watched a pay per view movie. All in all we spent about $400 which is a lot for us, but it was well worth it. I do wish we could have this experience more often, say for Valentine's Day, but as a regular occurence it would be out of our price range. Staff were polite and quick to service. We would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A breath of FRESH AIR”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this place! Who ever is in charge they have got the formula right. From the moment I booked on line 'til the time we checked out they were consistantly GREAT. Everyone made us feel so welcome, nothing was any trouble and the rooms are awesome. The location is safe and there's plenty to do around the hotel. I am unable to understand why we didn't discover this sooner - as for it being #7 in Vancouver, we think it should be #1.

Reviews.Title: “Great but warnings if you plan to work in the room”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerSonomaCounty
Reviews.Content: Agree with the majority of the other reviewers on ambiance, room quality, service, location, bed comfort -- all high quality. Heads up if you are a business traveller. My partner and I both had problems with the wireless internet connections. He got connected sometimes, me not at all. The front desk provided a cable, which worked fine but there is only one outlet (in the bedoroom with none in the parlour area, which limits you to working in bedroom only). Also had no success with wireless in lobby. Another drawback -- the desk chair was a very hard sidechair, not an adjustable desk chair. Working at the desk for very long was pretty uncomfortable. There is a bedroom speakerphone. I will add that the hotel was strikingly quiet. We heard none of the typical hotel noises during our 3 night stay including a Friday night. And I know there were people on either side. We commented on it constantly since it is so unusual. I mention this because another review mentioned noise. It may depend on location. We were away from the elevator on a low floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janiel
Reviews.Content: This is a really Beautiful hotels with the bedroom furniture done in Mahogany. The staff were very nice and helpful. It is located in a great spot for walking around the city. It was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter086
Reviews.Content: It is like something you would see in Vegas with gold everywhere. The concierge was very helpful. We had an excellent view of the "Bank Of Montreal" The bar downstairs was nice. It wasn't too far a walk from "B.C Place" where I went to a CFL game. I probably would come back

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice European Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdoll
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the centre of downtown Vancouver, this hotel is a good option with a quite location. The boutique style hotel is only a couple blocks from the harbour (cruise ship terminal) and a couple blocks to trendy shopping on Robson Street. I dined at the their restaurant one night, and the food was delicious, with friendly staff. The hotel has very nice high end finishing, but the rooms are a little on the small side. The hotel doesn't have a sauna/hot tub, but there is access to one next door. For the two night stay it was very nice, and I would stay there again. Decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great decor and staff”
Reviews.Author: camelbak_or_bust
Reviews.Content: I live locally in Vancouver and have passed by the hotel on numerous occassions and have always liked the look of the lobby. I wanted to find a hotel downtown so that I could stay after a night on the town, and found a really good rate on the hotel website so booked. I was not disappointed. From the moment of walking in the gorgeous lobby, through check in and all the way to check out, the service was excellent. The front desk crew are friendly, but professional. Our room was on the fifth floor and was exactly as depicted on the website. Very nice decor, Aveda products in the bathroom, nice big shower stall and big fluffy bed. Everything was spotless and the room was incredibly quiet. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was prompt and very good. The only downside was the people next door that kept going in and out of their door...non-stop for about 15 minutes, at about 8 in the morning (I was sleeping in)....very loud, but that is nothing against the hotel itself. I am moving out of Vancouver soon, but when I come back to visit I will definitely come back to La Hotel Soleil. Felt right at home. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Charm”
Reviews.Author: CabLam
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le Soleil was fabulous. It was close to the shopping areas, restaurants, and the strip of bars on Granville. The room itself was clean and comfortable. There were complimentary white robes provided and dual shower heads. We had a nice view of the downtown city lights. The concierge was knowledgeable and courteous. He recommended good restaurants and bars to go to. There was a reasonable price for valet, but it's the better than finding street parking. We had a wonderful time in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to start with”
Reviews.Author: KingWhale
Reviews.Content: It has a small but beautiful lobby. The rooms/suites are nicely decorated and comfortable. The staff are friendly even though not totally knowledgeable as to driving directions. Pros: many, good place and comfortable Cons: parking fee is a bit high. Wireless internet not very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space for a little bit of dough.”
Reviews.Author: B-ram-z
Reviews.Content: Overall, I think this hotel is a true bargain when booked directly from their website. While I had no view at all on the fifth floor, the size of the suite more than made up for it. It was really nice to stretch out on the sofa and chill, watching bad Canadian TV after a big day of walking all over Vancouver. The pictures posted by other reviewers were quite accurate. The location was great for shopping and right between two subway stops. Not a hopping lobby or bar scene, but who wants to party in a hotel anyway? As an American, I found prices in Vancouver to be be much more than I was used to, but this hotel was a pleasant surprise for about what I'd pay for a Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Hanmer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel while in town for a Christmas party. We thought the decor was fabulous and the room was very well laid out with a seperate seating area. We live locally and stay in Vancouver hotels on occasion, and we found this one to be one of the best for service, location and price. Our room only had a shower but that's all I wanted (no time for a bath) and even though the room overlooked busy Hornby Street, we didn't notice any noise. We would deffinately stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, Le Soleil delivers”
Reviews.Author: ozcanuck
Reviews.Content: Le Soleil is one of the high points of business travel for me - it's where I always stay while in Vancouver. I've reviewed it before, and my comments still stand - for value, location, and amenities, it is hard to beat. Arrived late and was welcomed by Paul at the front desk - had me on my way with a bottle of water in under a minute. Was given a room on the 15th floor - a little higher than usual. I noted this hotel has neither a 13th, nor a 14th floor - kind of weird. All the rooms are suites, and while space is at a premium within each room, they are all thoughtfully arranged - right down to the sliding door to the bathroom. Free wireless is a plus in every room. The decor is not to everyone's taste - other reviewers will agree. Kind of turkish bordello meets provencal chic. My only complaint is that some furnishings and carpet are starting to look slightly worn; maybe it's time for a full refresh of the property (inclduing space saving flat screen TVs. Quiet accommodation is important to me, and Le Soleil always delivers. Wish they would provide a more mainstream newspaper in the morning (National Post is on offer) - I'd prefer a Globe or a local Vancouver rag. Will I stay here again? Yes, again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A little too "busy"”
Reviews.Author: Ny_NyNY_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Was told this hotel was one of Vancouver's hottest boutique hotels....and was very disappointed. From the entrance off of a busy street - not much room to get past the street peddlers into a small lobby. The desk clerk was knowledgable, but very pompous -- something I'd expect from a Ritz or Four Seasons. The room decor was very "busy" too....hard to focus, and they had ancient bedspreads, the kind that are disgusting in hidding all sorts of nasty things. (Hint - get new clean white duvets like most boutique hotels!). Our room overlooked the busy street, which was noisy all day & night. We asked another clerk on the way out to dinner about a quieter room and she said the rooms on the other side of the hotel look out over Vancouver's busiest intersection --- not very reassuring! For almost $300, we should've stayed elsewhere and will next time. A nice Fairmont was just a couple blocks away in a much nicer location overlooking the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZgogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in October and booked a standard room. The Room was very nicely decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable with luxurious linens and the staff was very attentive. The hotel is close to Robson street shopping and restaurants and a very good value. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Le Soleil shines”
Reviews.Author: Cheekybaldy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week vacation to Vancouver. As we were staying at the Hotel Le Soliel for the full time, we had our fingers crossed all would be well with the accommodation. We need not have worried. From the warmest of welcomes from Maya on reception things just got better. All staff made us so welcome we ended feeling like part of the "Soleil family" . The room decor and standard of cleanliness was superb, the restaurant food exceptional and reasonably priced, and the great service from Rosa and the team just topped it off. Great location in downtown meant all attractions were within walking distance for us. The helpful advice from the concierge and reception staff led to an easy well planned holiday. Thanks to Maya for the fantastic whale watching trip she booked on our behalf. .........Would recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: MandFMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply wonderful. It is quite an elegant Boutique hotel. My husband and I shared a "queen suite" with our 11 and 13 year old. The rooms and lobby are beautifully appointed. Linens and towels are of superior quality. Housekeeping does a great job! You cannot ask for a better location in Vancouver. The staff is very knowledgeable and attentive. The nice thing about a smaller property is that the staff actually remembers who you are and what your preference are.
