They really want you to have a great stay. The concierge spent quite a bit of time with my 11 year old son picking restaurants and attractions. My son brought his sun glasses down with him one night and the concierge offered to deliver them to our room. It is really nice to find an elegant property that is so welcoming to a family. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “A great little downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandralawson
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at Le Soleil on arriving in Vancouver from London. The website directions were excellent for driving in from the airport and the staff and facilities were exceptionally good and helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable, especially the king size bed and soft feather (not foam) pillows. The Aveda toiletries were a nice touch as was the basket of apples in reception. Valet parking and helpful info from the hotel staff all added to a faultless stay. Not a cheap hotel, but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and great service at Le Soleil”
Reviews.Author: erinn_james
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located which is a plus if you're not renting a car. The staff was exceptionally friendly, I've never experienced this level of friendliness at a hotel before. The concierge was very helpful, we stayed on my birthday and he suggestion a great restaurant in Yaletown called Coast that I highly recommend. The room was very clean and very spacious. The restaurant was ok but it has fairly high prices. We only ate breakfast there so I don't know how dinner and lunch are in terms are quality. I recommend this hotel for the price, worth it! I would also like to make a side note about some things to do in Vancouver. We ate at a Malaysian Grill called the Banana Leaf on Broadway down a little ways from Kitsilano and I highly recommend this restaurant, great service, the food was top notch with a great variety and it is an all around great experience with an amazing ambiance. If you're looking to save a little money on transportation the public transit system is very good in Vancouver, you can buy a day pass for $8 and you can use it for the bus, the seabus or the skytrain and it's not hard to learn the system at all. Also, to save a little money there is another suspension bridge in the Lynn Canyon park that has free entry and there are nice trails and some waterfalls as well. Tip: Bring warm clothes, if it rains, which it tends to do alot, it gets fairly cool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful aura and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ericrule
Reviews.Content: This was wonderful for a pre and post cruise hotel. The service from the check in to the concierge, Brett was spectacular. I would not even look for another hotel when my travels bring me back to Vancouver. If I had anything to comment on it would be the noise from the cycling of the air conditioner in the suite we were in prior to our cruise. The room after our cruise was wonderful. As for a concierge with impeccable follow up, I sent an email requesting some ideas for our time in Vancouver and Brett got back to me in a few days enabling us to make reservations as some very fine restaurants. Use the concierge services and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Soleil”
Reviews.Author: robynDallas
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights. We loved it! The staff was very helpful and it was convenient to everything. It was nice coming back to the room after a day of sightseeing-very welcoming! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Le Soleil and it was great. We arrived before our room was ready and were called on our cellphone when we were able to get our key. The hotel lobby is small yet welcoming, staff are all pleasant and helpful. We had a corner suite and while I agree they are somewhat small, they definitely met our needs. Separate living room with couch, tv, desk and a separate small bedroom with tv and dresser. Bathroom was fine. Suite was well cleaned and there was large wall to wall windows, although no views. The location was fantastic, about 3 short blocks to Robson Street shopping, restaurants galore, coffee shops are abundant and an easy walk to the water. Cannot comment on room service or their restaurant as we didnt use either. But down the street is a wonderful Bakery Garden Cafe for breakfast and down the street from there is another italian cafe called Scuie which was wonderful too. Best latte I ever had!! Would definitely stay at Hotel Le Soleil again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hankypanky505
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in downtown Vancouver really impressed me. I had just spent three nights at the Fairmont in Whistler, so it was going to take a lot to impress me after that. Well, this place certainly did. I found that the staff at this hotel, the front desk, room service, and cleaning staff to be extremely good. The hotel is very centrally located in downtown so you can basically do your shopping and walk along the boardwalk by the ocean very easily. We had a junior suite, which was actually a pretty good size. I believe true to it's French roots, the room is almost European style. So that means that it's large by European standards, but maybe a little small by North American standards. However, it was definitely large enough for me and my wife and it was designed very well. Room service was very prompt and breakfast was very good, too, which was brought to us by two very professional and very sweet Asian gentlemen. What I found very impressive with the room service staff was that when they would give me the invoice to sign for the service, they walked to the front door and waited for me there. They weren't looking at me while I was trying to figure out how much of a tip I should leave, which I'm not very good at math so when someone is staring at me while I'm figuring out things, it's a little nerve-wracking. Anyway, that's the first time I've ever seen that done and I applaud whoever trained the staff to do that because it shows me that they think about little things like that. That just shows you that this small hotel tries to do the little things right, which is very important when competing with larger hotels in a similar category. Anyway, you cannot go wrong with this hotel, it's very French, of course, so linens and soaps and colors of the rooms are all very nicely decorated. Also, Vancouver is an expensive city, so I felt that the rates at this hotel were very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this fine boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply special.”
Reviews.Author: Milvert
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 weeks in Canada. Stayed at several 5 star hotels but found this boutique hotel to be a real find. The room was stunning and the decor throughout the hotel was lovely. Reception was particularly helpful and polite and the food in the restaurant next door was very good and reasonable for the quality provided. We found wine a little expensive but this was common throughout the holiday. Location for eating and shopping in Downtown Vancouver was excellent. Not the cheapest but among the best we stayed in. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCharlotte
Reviews.Content: Arriving on a very late night flight from New York (we reached the hotel at about 2:30am), the beginning was very promising: even though the front desk staff was not particularly pleasant (no smile, too uptight) at least the online booking worked and we did have a room. Yes that's true, the "suites" (really only a large room with a partition to turn it into a suite) are on the small side. But the very nice decoration compensates. The view from our room was not great: on the YMCA on one side and office buildings on the other. The "suite" was clean and the bathroom well appointed. Alas! The promising start only lasted for 2 days (out of 5) since, to my unpleasant surprise, my nightware had disappeared when I got back on the evening of the 3rd day. I immediately called housekeeping; they weren't there so was told by front desk staff (very rude) that they would get back to me. They did not on that day, nor even on the following morning. I had to call them again. I was then told that what might have happened was that the cleaning person might have accidentally taken my nightware away with the bedding for cleaning. I was literrally then told that this sometimes happened!! They assured me, after I had had several phone calls with the housekeeping manager, that they would look for it. They got back to me (it was then about a week and a half after the item had disappeared) to tell me they could not find it and see how to compensate. Fair enough they did say they would refund the equivalent of one night (I am still waiting to see it on my statement though). I am a "heavy" traveler, going both to industrialized and third world countries. This has NEVER EVER happened to me before. I don't think any hotel can pretend to luxury rating (as does Le Soleil) with such a poor housekeeping and front desk. First class service is not only about maintaining a room clean but also about making sure that this sort of things do not happen. Hotel Le Soleil has definitely still a long way to go to reach the higher end! On our last night in Vancouver, we stayed at the Metropolitan: THAT was first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eitrohs
Reviews.Content: We were heading up to Whistler, an decided to do a two night stop in Vancouver on our way. We got a pretty good deal on Le Soleil, had a quick look at reviews and loction, and went for it. The hotel is lovely - the interior is very golden and regal, but feels warm and welcoming. The reception area is small and feels familiar, rather than large and impersonal. Staff were very helpful and check-in swift. We had a basic twin suite, which consisted of a bedroom with twin beds, large tv, and a fair bit of drawer storage, a hallway with a good sized closet, and a sitting room with sofa, armchair, table and another large tv. The bathroom had a doublesized shower with a seat. I've noticed one complaint has been the room is "small" - neither the bed area nor the seating area are huge by any means, but there is plenty enough to store luggage away and move around - and for us that included a large snowboard bag! The room was lovely and we could not fault the location - everything was a 5 minute walk, from Gastown to Robson Street, Stanley Park was 15 minutes. It is also extremely close to Burrard St Skytrain and a multitude of bus stops. All in all great hotel and felt a lot more intimate and special than larger hotels, will definately stay again if in Vancouver and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: NY2LV
Reviews.Content: I read quite a few reviews and I expected so much more from Hotel Soleil. The bellman was extremely pleasant. I think he was the only good thing about the place. The lady at the front desk was clueless. Upon check in she said are room was not ready and she would contact the cleaning crew to find out when it would be ready. So we went to Starbucks when we returned 10 minutes later I asked her if she spoke to the cleaning people like she said and she said no. That's all she said. She just looked at me and said no she had not. Thanks for the specifics. The lobby is very charming. We went to our room a "suite" The rooms are so Tiny, I would guess 6 feet wide. The couch in the "Living Room" was like sitting on rocks. The carpet was filthy. The bathroom was the best room until I looked p and noticed the Mold all over the ceiling. The bed in the "bedroom" was practically wall to wall and the bed was so uncomfortable. I have stayed in hotels from budget to luxury and cleanliness was the biggest problem for me here. The room was so stuffy. It seems like it was nice at some point but even the wallpaper was dirty. I would rather stay in one decent sized room than two teeny tiny rooms seperated by a bathroom that you can't even stretch your arms out. Upon check out the same women didn't even speak. She charged us for parking $22.00 p/day which was included. After I reviewed the receipt I told her about the error. She just took the paper out of my hand and didn't say anything, she corrected it and just gave me a new receipt not saying anything. Her apologies for trying to rip me off would have been nice. The restaurant that is connected had a great dinner, so the morning we left we stopped in for breakfast. It was like a different place. The prices for 2 eggs was the same as a delicious Halibut entree. Oh yeah and the eggs were cold and the potato's were hard. My boyfriend took one bite of his French toast and decided to avoid it. They were nice enough to just take it off the bill because they noticed he didn't touch it. Next time I am sticking the the Marriott. This place couldn't get me back for $50.00 CAD. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ColdChisel
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 11am off a long flight, they got us into a room around 12 which was great. the room was small in size with a seperate sitting room but other than that very nice. Loved the furnishings, it was clean, large bathroom, bath robes, mini bar(expensive). Housekeeping did walk into our room at 10.30am on the day we where checking out (check out was 12) and the night clerk was a little slow. We wanted to extend our stay but didnt because the night clerk told us originally that the rate would be the same then about 20 min later he called us in our room and said that the 2nd night was going to be an extra $60 to what we where originally told. It is also in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in this wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Le Soleil for 5 days before our Alaskan cruise. It was great! The room was spacious, comfortable and clean! There are bath robes in the room to use- it was nice touch! Room service was also very good. I highly recommend this hotel! The location of the hotel was perfect. It was close to shopping, and plenty of restaurants. We walked nearly everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londongizzmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Soleil 23-27 January after spending 3 nights in New York. We arrived early for check-in as we landed in Vancouver at 10am, but were told we could check in within another half an hour, which was a nice gesture as we had been up early for the flight from JFK. Staff are very friendly here I found and extremely pleasant. Always a greeting whenever we passed reception and even staff passing in corridors exchanged a friendly smile and a good morning/evening. The location of the hotel is good too. A five minute walk from Canada Place and a 10 minute walk from Gastown. It’s also close to Robson street with the shops, café’s etc. We took a trip to Grouse Mountain whilst there which was pleasant and the girl on reception was very helpful and knowledgeable in assisting us. The value I found to be excellent for a hotel of this quality. A lot of people appear to think it is not good value but to British people it certainly is (we paid CA$ 109 per night – I am not sure what the going rate is for hotels in Canada but this is very inexpensive I think). The rooms were small but you have the added benefit of a separate living area with sofa, table and TV which you can partition off from the bedroom area. There was also ample storage space and the rooms equipped with everything one should require (iron/ironing board, laundry service, coffee maker, kettle, safe, cordless phone even!) The bathroom was great – large double shower and marbled walls with excellent lighting and huge mirror. Aveda products a nice touch also, as were the bathrobes and coffee maker. Beds I found to be comfortable – I notice a few people had problems from some of the reviews, but to me no different than other beds I have slept on. Sheets changed daily too. I found the hotel to be clean – apart from a bit of dust I noticed on the TV cabinet – but in general cleaner than some western hotel chains I have stayed in and the room was serviced efficiently. We were on the 8th floor and had no trouble with noise whatsoever. The prices for the mini bar are high but I have yet to stay at a hotel with a reasonably priced mini bar and would like to hear from anyone who has! The “karma sutra” kit in the room was also nice touch if you’re planning that sort of weekend!! We didn’t eat at the adjoining restaurant but we did have breakfast on our last day, delivered to the room, which was good and delivered on time. No complaints there. In all I would say this is a lovely hotel and they go that little bit further with the extra touches that you would normally expect from hotels at triple the price. I would stay at this hotel again for sure if I were to return to Vancouver and Canadians appear to be a very warm and friendly nation. The only downside is that Vancouver itself is not what I expected (a lot of homeless people) and is quite a quiet city, though that could just be me from being used to living in London. However it is clean and friendly and appears to be a safe city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Soleil was superb”
Reviews.Author: Pippin2
Reviews.Content: I did an extensive internet search for a downtown Vancouver hotel. After settling on the Hotel Le Soleil, I booked the room through their home webpage and we stayed there on January 20th. My husband and I were very pleased. The location is perfect. A few blocks from fabulous shopping, a block from the water, and within walking distance of many fine restaurants. We were pleased with everything. The staff were friendly, the hotel spotless, and our room was nicely decorated. We had a comfortable king size bed and were not disturbed by any street noise. A very quiet room. We did not eat at the adjoining restaurant so cannot comment on their food. We will definately return to this hotel when visiting in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel + Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: nath100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best we've ever stayed out. The rooms were very comfortable and the hotel is immaculate inside. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and didn't hesitate to offer assistance when we enquired about taking a float plane ride out over the harbour and city ( a must do activity ! ). The hotel is in a great location, just a few blocks away from Robson street where there are loads of bars, restaurants and shops. Gastown and the harbour are a short walk, and its only a 10-15 min walk to Stanley park. This is a great hotel in a great city, and I’d recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Was a bit hesitant to book this hotel based on the reviews but got a great rate of $155 a night and decided to give it a go. While the hotel is not 100% perfect (could use new carpet, turn down service that didn't occur) and not 5 star, its as good as any other choice in Vancouver .which is certainly light on 5 star hotels (as in none). Poor man's Versace lobby and decor nothwithstanding, this was a comfortable hotel with solid 4 star service and an exceptional value. Comfy beds, high speed Internet for free (or I should say included in the rate) and a decent restaurant. Great fitness centre available for hotel guests as well. A super value and I would not hestitate to stay here again, in fact I am next week!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Viclugano
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I expected an old hotel, nice but a little run down. It was not the case! Check in was swift and friendly. I was upgraded to a suite. The bedroom side was not roomy, but everything was in perfect condition and clean. The bathroom was nice: it did not have a bathtub but a nice big shower, which I prefer. Wifi connection was free, but sometimes problematic. I liked the hotel size: rather small when compared to other hotels. The restaurant was well decorated, but I did not have a chance to try it. The position is great, walking distance to anything in the downtown area, gastown, yaletown, etc. I did not try the gym next door, or breakfast. One of many Starbucks in Vancouver is located across the street.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: bbbc46
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel mostly because it was one of the few to offer sleeping arrangements for a family of 4 without kids sharing beds. The few other properties offering suites with extra beds were either in iffy areas or very old. However, the rooms were very small so that when the sofa bed is open there is no floor space, that is no way to get to the bathroom or bedroom without climbing over the bed. Sort of defeats the purpose. Also, as in other reviews, our room was not ready on arrival and we were told that 15 others were ahead of us. I didn't know check in was first come first served. We were encouraged to check our luggage which we were told would be locked. As it turned out ours and many other group's bags were left in piles in the lobby unattended and unlocked for several hours before a bicycle type lock was finally looped through some of the handles. As one might guess a piece og our luggage was gone when we were finally able to check in. I will give the property points for location but there are so many hotels in the same area even that is somewhat moot. The hotel is well decorated and generally well maintained. We got little if any help from staff either with general questions or after the loss of our bag so would not give high marks for service. Valet parking is reasonable efficient but from my comparisons at $20 a day no bargain though not out of line either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: SnowReport
Reviews.Content: Le Soleil is an 11-story boutique hotel, well-located in downtown in Vancouver. We booked two 1 bedroom suites with sitting rooms. Our teens were in a room where the sitting room was near the door; this proved too noisy for my son to sleep in the sofa bed, so the staff immediately moved them to a room with twin beds, away from the hallway. My husband and I booked a "deluxe" 1 bedroom (very quiet) which had floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking some high rises. There is no water view from the hotel. Bedrooms and beds are not big, but all appointments to the rooms are top-notch, with the exception of our carpet, which appeared a little worn. Service was impeccable and the hotel restaurant warranted four stars. Breakfast was especially good and not overly expensive. If the restaurant is too pricey for you and you're traveling with tired children, the hotel has menus of restaurants that will deliver to your room. We enjoyed the Chinese food (a lot more than seedy Chinatown!). An adjacent YWCA provides fitness and family activities. Within an easy downhill walk to Canada Place (and the water) and around the corner from the Trolley tour shuttle stop at the Hyatt and a Skytrain station, the hotel is well, if not glamourously placed. It's not in any way on a dangerous block but is positioned primarily between office buildings. My husband travels frequently and found this small hotel and its attentive staff a refreshing change from the large, chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Franco53703
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three nights in early July 2006 and loved this hotel. It is very well located, just a few blocks and an easy walk from the financial center, the waterfront areas near the cruise ship terminal, and the bustling Robson St.--a mecca for the young crowd that you may or may not care for. The hotel's strongest point is the warmth and helpfulness of the staff. Everyone was eager to help and offer advice. When the concierge was not in, Isabelle, the hotel receptionist, offered wonderful suggestions on where to eat and what things to avoid. The attached restaurant was great for breakfast and perhaps also for other meals, but we decided to have them elsewhere. The suites are small indeed, but pleasantly appointed and comfortable. The beds and pillows could have been more comfortable, but this was our only disappointment in an altogether great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcoming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QuietWalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early June 2006 and the condition of our room was without reproach -- very clean and housekeeping staff attentive to special requests. Suites are "small," but fine for 1 or 2 people. Our room had a very large marble shower -- inquire if you wish a tub. Most important the staff -- everybody was wonderfully welcoming and attentive. Very bright, attractive, young people from all over the world, offering absolutely fluent English and numerous foreign languages that want to make your stay enjoyable! This is a "boutique" hotel, small, and the restaurant situation is not the best -- but there are many wonderful restaurants within short walking distance -- just ask the knowledgeable Concierge or any other staff person. And Vancouver is a city to walk for Pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelcritic-ca
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was solid out due to a convention so I could not stay at my usual location. I found the hotel to be clean, well maintained and the service very friendly. I arrived late and was upgraded to a suite at no charge. My only complaint was the bed was a little too hard for my liking but that is personal. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but beginning to slide towards shabby”
Reviews.Author: Kickedback
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Soleil during a business conference. The downtown location is perfect for enjoying all that the city has to offer. The lobby area is well maintained and the staff friendly and helpful. I had a queen cornersuite and while the suites are petite, I appreciated the separate sitting area for laying out my work and putting my feet up without having to use the bed. Though small, the bathroom is well appointed and I liked the deep soaking tub. On the negative side, the air conditioning unit was very loud and had to be turned off at night. The upholstery on the sitting room couch is about six months away from "gross" and most of the chairs and carpeting in my suite were noticeably stained. And yes, the bed is hard with the beginnings of a notable sag. My overall impression of this lovely boutique property is that management is "cutting corners" while trying to hang on to as many stars as they can. It should also be noted that the hotel's restaurant was chaotic. While some of the staff was exemplary, others were downright rude during the lunch rush. It turns out that the restaurant owner walked away with as much as he/she could carry just a few nights before and that the owners of the hotel were stepping in to "save" the place. There were noticeable groups of very intense (translation inhospitable) looking men standing around, glaring and making what help was there very nervous. On the up side, the eggplant appetiizer was amazing! I hope they can pull off restoring order to the restaurant and then turn their eyes and pocketbooks to refurbishing Le Soleil to the standard that this quickly aging property deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny suites!”
Reviews.Author: lucydodd
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and would probably stay elsewhere next time. The hotel is not bad- it's just not great either. We "upgraded" to a corner suite, for an extra charge. We were amazed at how small the "upgraded" suite was. Also- do not stay below the 11th floor in this hotel- neighbouring building walls are right up against your windows. With the small size of the suites if you are at all claustrophobic you will not find it pleasant. The heating/ventilation system is very loud. And yes, the bed was hard! Now for the good parts- the staff is excellent. They could not be friendlier and the room was clean. The Aveda products are a nice touch and the towels and linens are good quality. There are windows that open- always nice to be able to get some fresh air. The location is also very convenient. There are just so many hotels in Vancouver that this one doesn't get my vote for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Top ranked hotel that is very conveniently located centrally downtown Vancouver. Very pleasant and helpful staff and doormen. One block away from Pacific Center Shopping. Several restaurants within walking distance. Rooms are nicely decorated. Bathrooms do not have tubs, only large showers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have a family friend staying at this hotel and I viewed the rooms last night. It is very quaint and quite nicely decorated with nice wallpaper and nice bedding/linens. Contrary to another review I read, this is a safe part of town (in the middle of the financial district). I live here, so I know! There is the odd street person asking for change, but that's Vancouver for you. They're harmless, and don't buy their stories like they need change for the bus or whatever because you'll see them there every day saying the same thing. The only thing we noted hotel-wise was a $75 charge for pets (even for a small 5lb non-shedding dog). The beds are a little hard, but everything else was quite nice. The price was also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a second trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to Vancouver many times. Usually stay at the Westin Bayshore, but chose Le Soleil this time. They said it used to be run or owned by Sheraton and all the positive reviews made me want to check it out. The reservationist was very nice and helpful. They said they would e-mail me confirmation of my reservation but after a week and two additional telephone requests (with long waits on hold) later, still no e-mail. The decor was nice. The corner suite was small. The queen sized mattress was rock hard and my back was sore the whole next day. While the location was OK, other hotels are just as close or closer to Robson street. The restaurant next door did not have a Sunday brunch buffet like we had hoped (like some of the other hotels). Yes, you could use the YWCA next door, but for a high fee - also it closes at 5:00 p.m. on the weekends so a relaxing end of day swim or sauna is out. I'll try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bridgemagoo2
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. Staff were so friendly nothing was too much trouble and lots of thoughtful touches such as complimentary small bottles of water at reception for thirsty travellers arriving. The room was great and although we were initially advised that only twin beds were available (it did say this when we booked) they kindly found us one with a king sized bed - you may want to check availability of this in advance. Well placed for Canada Place and Robson Street. Cannot recommend too highly, we would definitely make this our first choice on return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite as Grand as expected”
Reviews.Author: TravelfomSeattle
Reviews.Content: For all the hype I had seen on this hotel and the hefty price, I think I went expecting a bit more than I should have. The staff was professional but not overly kind or helpful. Our room was very small with a view of the childrens roof top play ground next door. The bed was very comfortable. Other than sleeping the room was just not comfortable to come back and relax in. We were handed a flyer on the street hyping up free appetizers at the a joining resturant and we thought we would check it out. After having to ask for them and squeezing into some stools at the tiny bar, we were served 4 chicken wings. It was a waste of time. The location was nice as I could walk to my convention on the waterfront with ease and several shopping locations.
